column2: Hi, so over the last few weeks I have been working on setting up a Hygieia Dashboard. I have been able to successfully install all the collectors and see a really cool dashboard. I did find a problem with the hygieia-jenkins plugin though. When you specify the buildStatus on the pipeline syntax for hygieiaBuildPublishStep it does not filter out builds that do not meet the criteria. Additionally I could not find where in mongodb did the buildStatus information get stored. If someone has any idea how to find any information on this or knows the fix, please help. Thank you.
column5: Hygieia-Jenkins Plugin hygieiaBuildPublishStep Broken
column10:
504131797 Are you using a freestyle job or a pipeline in jenkins? In Mongo the build information goes into `Builds`  collection rvema
504133332 I am using Jenkins pipeline. The builds table has it, thank you for that. I still don't know why the pipeline does not filter the builds though. srivasis

column2:
Hello,

I am trying to integrate Fortify with Hygieia. I have seen the posts that say that we need the following .jar files in order to build the collector: 

com.fortify:fortify-common:jar:4.30,
com.fortify:fortify-crypto:jar:1.0,
com.fortify:fortify-meta-api:jar:4.30,
com.fortify:fortify-meta-impl:jar:4.30,
com.fortify:fortify-public:jar:4.30,
com.sun.xml.wsit:xws-security:jar:1.3.1,
com.sun.xml.wsit:wsit-rt:jar:1.1,
com.fortify:wsclient:jar:4.30,
com.fortify:wsobject:jar:4.30,

I have fortify and was wondering in what location can I find these files?

Thank you!
@tabladrum

column2:
When using the GitHub configuration widget and editing an existing configuration if I do not re-enter the 'Personal Access Token', the system will re-encrypt the Token leading to Access Denied errors when the GitHub collector runs..

This raises a related question.  Why is the Personal Access Token sent back to the user's browser?  It is not being de-encrypted and in this UI mode, can't really be used for anything.  It is resulting in errors being produced when editing the form if one is not fully aware of the underlying UI processing mechanism.  There are other issues I see, that if interested we can discuss off line.
column5: Github Widget
column10: 502830093 @jlogancase This is a bug we recently found and will work on getting it fixed. rvema

column2:
I have multiple sonar qube instances (for historical reasons). If I make a modification to the configuration through the UI the records get reordered in the database. However in the properties file there are version numbers and REST query URLs that are hardcoded to a certain array index...

Obviously this causes problems. Should be fetching the version from the sonar instance. and the metric string can just be part of the client class.

column2:
Looks like Sonar has set a max page size of 500 on api/projects as well now. Experimenting out our Sonar system with 1333 projects, nothing is returned from the collector beyond the first page. Can we add paging support to have the collector loop through all pages increment the pageIndex until all records are collected? 

Related to: https://github.com/Hygieia/Hygieia/issues/933
column5: Sonar Collector: Unable to pull in projects beyond the first page (500 records)
column10:
501361074 After pulling the code I think I see the issue. There is paging already on this. It calculated the total records and divides by the PAGE_SIZE and rounds up to the correct number of pages needed to pull the records. When it pulls the record it adds &p=pageNumber but from what I can tell it doesn't send the pagesize. The max page size is 500, however, when I ran this query without setting the page size it looks like the default is 100. so it only returns 100 records at a time but the for loop is assuming 500 records at a time so only 1/5 of the records are returned. My suggestion is to either pass in the pageSize in the url as well or reduce the PAGE_SIZE to 100 to use the default. irwindouglas
501362183 well, just found the code that is setting the pagesize as well when appending URL_RESOURCES. Now I am not sure why we are only seeing records from the first 500 projects... irwindouglas
501370104 Reduced our total sonar projects (pruned branches and older projects) to 500 and our project starting showing up. Still tracking down the issue but definitely was not showing in the auto-complete before in the UI widget irwindouglas
501385023 In collector_items filtering on com.capitalone.dashboard.model.SonarProject only 491 records exist but if I query Sonar directly there are 543 records. I would expect these to match so there must be something causing the records to not fully process. Looking through the error logs only show a few warning on a cookie it doesn't like but no errors. irwindouglas

I am working on enhancing the rally collector to capture defect/Testcase data along with all existing information. Looking for help or any pointer to start.

@Satheesh-Balachandran - I believe you have last worked on the rally collector, is there anything you can help me with,

Below are the end points which gives the required information for Defects/Testcases.

Number of Open Defects for a Project - `https://rally1.rallydev.com/slm/webservice/v2.0/defect?project=https://rally1.rallydev.com/slm/webservice/v2.0/project/<Project-id>&query=(state="open")`

Number of TestCases - `https://rally1.rallydev.com/slm/webservice/v2.0/testcase?project=https://rally1.rallydev.com/slm/webservice/v2.0/project/81341151288`
column5: Enhancing Rally Collector to capture Defect & Test Cases

#############################################################################

Resolves https://github.com/Hygieia/Hygieia/issues/2956 https://github.com/Hygieia/Hygieia/issues/2942

With one of the recent PRs related to the Bitbucket collector (PR #2678) I've encountered an issue after the collector writes it's first time to the database. It thereafter can't read the time back from the collector_item, and would crash with the exception...
```
 java.lang.ClassCastException: java.lang.Long cannot be cast to java.util.Date
 	at com.capitalone.dashboard.model.GitRepo.getLastUpdateTime(GitRepo.java:53) ~[bitbucket-scm-collector-3.0.2-SNAPSHOT.jar!/:3.0.4]
 	at com.capitalone.dashboard.collector.GitCollectorTask.collect(GitCollectorTask.java:154) ~[bitbucket-scm-collector-3.0.2-SNAPSHOT.jar!/:3.0.2-SNAPSHOT]
 	at com.capitalone.dashboard.collector.CollectorTask.run(CollectorTask.java:63) ~[core-3.0.4.jar!/:3.0.2-SNAPSHOT]
 	at org.springframework.scheduling.support.DelegatingErrorHandlingRunnable.run(DelegatingErrorHandlingRunnable.java:54) ~[spring-context-4.2.5.RELEASE.jar!/:4.2.5.RELEASE]
 	at org.springframework.scheduling.concurrent.ReschedulingRunnable.run(ReschedulingRunnable.java:81) [spring-context-4.2.5.RELEASE.jar!/:4.2.5.RELEASE]
 	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511) [na:1.8.0_212]
 	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266) [na:1.8.0_212]
 	at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.access$201(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:180) [na:1.8.0_212]
 	at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.run(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:293) [na:1.8.0_212]
 	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149) [na:1.8.0_212]
 	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624) [na:1.8.0_212]
 	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748) [na:1.8.0_212
```

Did I misconfigure something or is did `getLastUpdateTime()` miss the refactor of how the collector handles it's time?
column5: Bug with Bitbucket collector after initial commit/pr pull
column10:
499896105 @shishirchaturvedi  @rvema @Sbrenthughes OneMoreByte
499905857 @OneMoreByte I am looking at this. shishirchaturvedi
499911474 @Sbrenthughes In my last PR for Bitbucket SCM collector enhancement, I changed `LastUpdateTime` field on GitRepo collection from java.util.Date to Long(milliSeconds). It is a Hygeia standard to use Time Stamps in long millis. Based on the code review comments I've changed 'LastUpdateTime' to long but it is breaking existing users of SCM bitbucket collectors. I can submit a PR to change this field back to java.util.Date. What do you think? 
https://github.com/Hygieia/Hygieia/pull/2678/files/c80ecf29b462e618ad01fc81aa5fa1eced5d98cd..ac22374626fc5cc70a72b2eade3773ece2d10397#r252381324 shishirchaturvedi
499929010 @OneMoreByte You are right. I missed the conversion of LastUpdateTime field (Date->Long). My intention was to use Long for LastDateTime field but somehow missed to update it uniformly.
I have submitted this [PR](https://github.com/Hygieia/Hygieia/pull/2958) and it would be great if you can validate it. shishirchaturvedi
499935921 @OneMoreByte Please let me know if you still encounter any issue. I feel that this change of LastUpdateTime from Date to Long might break existing users fo Bitbucket scm collector. I could be wrong. 
cc @Sbrenthughes   shishirchaturvedi
499957314 @OneMoreByte The PR is in, please validate rvema
500036420 @shishirchaturvedi @rvema Sorry to get to this so late on Friday. The PR seemed to do the trick. Thanks so much for your promptness! OneMoreByte

column2:
Hello everyone,

I'm very new to DevOps and want to learn how to incorporate collectors like Sonarqube and Fortify into Hygieia using an EC2 image that contains Docker.

I've already found a few sonar examples such as the one here https://github.com/docker-library/docs/tree/master/sonarqube, but I am having trouble since my portainer image already uses port 9000. I'm not sure what to change the port to in the 
$ docker run -d --name sonarqube -p 9000:9000 sonarqube
command.

Right now, I don't have anything from Sonarqube or Fortify to pull in, but I am trying to be ready because that will be my next step.

Thank you very much!
column5: Sonar integration in Docker-contained EC2
column10:
499619360 @JFDonaghy Are you having trouble to bring up the sonar server on any port other than 9000? and then try configuring with Hygieia? rvema
499901543 Thank you very much for reaching out! I found a video that helped me realize that you can change the port, by un-commenting a line in the sonar.properties file (for anyone looking at this later: search for TCP port).

I still have other problems to fix (like a 'bean' error), but I will close this issue. JFDonaghy

column5: Integrating Bitbucket into Hygieia using Docker

column2:
Hello,
I recently started a Hygieia Dashboard by running the ui and api as docker containers. I want to integrate Jenkins into Hygieia and cannot find any instructions on how to do so, especially for docker. I did find instructions for integration if the dash was deployed not through docker but nothing for docker container deployment.
Thank you in advance.
column5: Integrate Jenkins into Hygieia Dash (Setup using Docker)
column10:
499540856 @srivasis Can you check this project - https://github.com/Hygieia/hygieia-starter-kit and see if that helps rvema
499542504 Will do, thank you!  srivasis
499547783 I am just starting off with Hygieia and i know some of these questions might be very basic. So, I am trying to figure out how this works in a larger scheme of things. The hygieia-ui docker image i pulled contains the frontend part of the dash and the hygieia-api is the one that talks to the mongodb. How exactly are the collectors then configured if you are working with docker? According to the architecture picture on this page https://hygieia.github.io/Hygieia/architecture.html and my understanding of the docker containers i have created i believe i have the ui, api and mongo db setup but nothing available for the collectors. Could someone give me more information on this or point me in the right direction thanks. srivasis

column2: Artifactory Collector - Allow multiple binary artifacts
column5: Artifactory Collector - Allow multiple binary artifacts

column2:
On the first execution of the Jenkins collector there is a NPE that prevents the collector document for Jenkins from being created. This prevents the General Configuration page from showing the Jenkins configuration.

NPE is avoided by initializing the offending fields in the HudsonSettings class.
column5: Fix NPE breaking admin page config
column10: 499487269 @fidelcoria-aa Can you fix the compilation errors in your PR, The build is failing due to missing imports in HudsonSettings rvema

column2:
I was playing with the artifactory artifact collector docker container and I noticed that the properties-builder.sh for it produced a property file with out of date syntax. ([this](https://github.com/Hygieia/Hygieia/blob/master/collectors/artifact/artifactory/docker/properties-builder.sh#L41-L51) and [this](https://github.com/Hygieia/Hygieia/blob/master/collectors/artifact/artifactory/docker/properties-builder.sh#L81-L103) vs [what the docs say](https://hygieia.github.io/Hygieia/artifactory.html#sample-application-properties-file))

In looking at some of the un-merged PRs I noticed one where the api and api-audit container Dockerfiles were being re-written with mounted directory for the properties file (#2767). Is that a refactor that all the containers will eventually hit? Or does the properties-builder.sh for artifactory just need some updating?

Thanks!
column5: Question about state of Docker containers (Artifactory properties-builder)

499181309 @OneMoreByte The PR#2767 needs to be reworked which we are working with the developer to get it done. Regarding the properties-builder.sh w.r.t. artifactory collector it needs some updates. Please feel free to contribute back if you have some bandwidth, it would be greatly appreciated. rvema
499266215 Alright, I can probably spare the time for the fix for that. But as far as where the containers are going are the properties-builder.sh scripts going to be replaced with volumes like that? OneMoreByte

column5: Data not populating on deploy dashboard
column10: 498492444 @ajayakumar-jayaraj The jenkins collector at this point is capable of populating only the build widget. The deploy widget is populated by any of the collectors under deploy folder of Hygieia project. At this moment there are collectors for xdeploy and udeploy. If you use a different toolset for deployment or would like to use Jenkins as a mode of deployment then you may leverage the hygieia-publisher-plugin (Hygieia plugin for Jenkins) to push data into Hygieia from Jenkins by adding a deploy step to your Jenkins pipeline. Please see this link for more details - https://github.com/Hygieia/Hygieia/blob/gh-pages/pages/hygieia/hygieia-jenkins-plugin/hygieia-jenkins-plugin.md. If this is information is sufficient please go ahead and close this issue. Thanks rvema 498656979 @rvema jenkins-Hygieia publisher is publishing deployment information to deploy widget, but in the product dashboard i am not able to see any commits and other stats like avg time and standard deviation for the environments like Dev and QA. i am able to see the commit and build info in product dashboard. IATVirtusa 498658061 @IATVirtusa @rvema I am having the same issue with jenkins-Hygieia publisher plugin here i am attaching the screens ![Screenshot (27)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14222254/58880453-86e86f00-86f5-11e9-8ab6-4376c2e1baf4.png) gopiprasanthpotipireddy 498872284 > @ajayakumar-jayaraj The jenkins collector at this point is capable of populating only the build widget. The deploy widget is populated by any of the collectors under deploy folder of Hygieia project. At this moment there are collectors for xdeploy and udeploy. If you use a different toolset for deployment or would like to use Jenkins as a mode of deployment then you may leverage the hygieia-publisher-plugin (Hygieia plugin for Jenkins) to push data into Hygieia from Jenkins by adding a deploy step to your Jenkins pipeline. Please see this link for more details - https://github.com/Hygieia/Hygieia/blob/gh-pages/pages/hygieia/hygieia-jenkins-plugin/hygieia-jenkins-plugin.md. If this is information is sufficient please go ahead and close this issue. Thanks @rvema Thanks for the info . I have configured Jenkins plugin and followed the link you shared. I am able to get metrics in build dashboard , but still i am not seeing data in deploy dashboard. can you please advise on it.. ajayakumar-jayaraj 499143472 @ajayakumar-jayaraj @IATVirtusa are you using a Jenkinsfile or post build steps? Right now Post build steps do not publish deploy data. For now, To get deploy data, you need to migrate to a Jenkinsfile for your jobs. We will be fixing this in the future. If you are using a Jenkinsfile please tell me which Hygieia steps you are using. Ex, hygieiaPublishDeployStep, hygieiaArtifactPublishStep, etc Sbrenthughes 499181050 @rvema @Sbrenthughes ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32649250/58976714-21988a80-8796-11e9-8013-e08b9ff82ab4.png) hygieiaDeployPublishStep applicationName: 'hygieia-test', artifactDirectory: 'app/target', artifactGroup: 'com.mycompany.app', artifactName: '*.jar', artifactVersion: '', buildStatus: 'Success', environmentName: 'uat' ajayakumar-jayaraj 499420431 @rvema can you share the sample jenkinsfile for hygiea-jenkins plugin. it is helpful. gopiprasanthpotipireddy 499498579 @gopiprasanthpotipireddy one way is use to use the post build step in your jenkins job. For steps in pipeline, please see some example syntax of various steps: `hygieiaDeployPublishStep applicationName: "someapp", artifactDirectory: 'dist/', artifactGroup: 'somegroup', artifactName: 'somename', artifactVersion: "someversion", buildStatus: 'Success', environmentName: "someenviroment"` `hygieiaSonarPublishStep ceQueryIntervalInSeconds: 10, ceQueryMaxAttempts: 30` `hygieiaTestPublishStep buildStatus: 'Success', testApplicationName: 'Cucumbertest', testEnvironmentName: 'Dev', testFileNamePattern: '*.json', testResultsDirectory: '/', testType: 'Functional'` `hygieiaBuildPublishStep buildStatus: 'Success'` rvema 499522422 @rvema what is the exact steps in jenkinsfile to get metrics in product dashboard. do i need to use both hygieiaDeployPublishStep and hygieiaArtifactPublishStep or any one of this is enough? gopiprasanthpotipireddy 499523277 The same issue i rised here. https://github.com/Hygieia/Hygieia/issues/2893 gopiprasanthpotipireddy 499545001 @gopiprasanthpotipireddy each of the mentioned steps are discrete and you would need to invoke all the steps if you need information about all of them. rvema 499780898 ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14222254/59086851-94ce0800-8920-11e9-9139-c0e77e961983.png) @rvema now i am able to get the commits in dev stage but not the metrics using jenkinsfile. gopiprasanthpotipireddy 499839103 ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14222254/59098576-4af41a80-893e-11e9-861b-fd45bd642e21.png) the product view is like in the attachment. @rvema can you suggest any doc regarding the metrics logic. gopiprasanthpotipireddy 500328835 @rvema i am able to see the stage metrics in the product view. gopiprasanthpotipireddy

column2:
I have UI and API components running on same remote server. UI is served using `gulp serve` as of now.
API is currently running on 8081 port with following configuration
```
dbname=dashboarddb
dbreplicaset=false
dbhostport=localhost:27017
server.contextPath=/api
server.port=8081
logRequest=true
corsEnabled=true
corsWhitelist=http://<IP_ADDRESS>:3000
```
gulpfile.js file content
```
    config = {
        module: 'hygieia-dashboard',
        local: null,
        api: 'http://<IP_ADDRESS>:8081',
        refresh: 60
    };
```
When I click on login button, I get ✅ meaning API connectivity is working properly.
When I try to signup for new user, I get *User already exist* issue. However the actual issue is related to CORS. Here is the screenshot -
![Screen Shot 2019-05-31 at 1 27 01 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7900526/58734828-5e870a80-83ad-11e9-9c57-2d95166d2b12.png)
Even if I have added proper whitelisting for CORS configuration */api/registerUser* is not setting proper header *Access-Control-Allow-Origin*
Following are the two screenshots which might help

1. Initial */registerUser* request with OPTIONS
![Screen Shot 2019-05-31 at 1 34 09 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7900526/58734950-ca697300-83ad-11e9-8fc0-ec3c01bd20dc.png)
2. Second */registerUser* request with POST
![Screen Shot 2019-05-31 at 1 33 18 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7900526/58735005-f553c700-83ad-11e9-8023-209c9c4c771d.png)


This issue is similar to #1710 
/cc @juantoledo @nireeshT @stevegal @jshpopelka272 @tabladrum

Thanks in advance
column5: CORS issue when api port other than 8080
column10:
497874348 During signup even if I am getting error that *User already exists*, it doesn't exist before signup and gets created anyhow. bargemb
498503538 @bargemb Can you verify if your api is active on port 8081 by running a sample request using a rest client like postman? rvema
498504913 @bargemb did you try the suggestion from @stevegal  in the issue referenced above?
`You may run into quite a lot of cors issues. I work around this by setting up an httpd service to act as a reverse proxy to api and hi so they all have the same server and port. Otherwise the api needs lots of changes to allow cors` rvema
498697788 > @bargemb Can you verify if your api is active on port 8081 by running a sample request using a rest client like postman?

@rvema API seems to work as I was successfully able to get **true** response when I hit http://<IP_ADDRESS>:8081/api/ping


> @bargemb did you try the suggestion from @stevegal in the issue referenced above?
> `You may run into quite a lot of cors issues. I work around this by setting up an httpd service to act as a reverse proxy to api and hi so they all have the same server and port. Otherwise the api needs lots of changes to allow cors`

It seems that dockerized version of Hygieia uses NGINX for the same purpose.  I am switching to dockerized installation.

Just wanted to confirm that changing port for API is not a smooth ride


 bargemb
498794677 @bargemb we have not explored using a port other than 8080 for UI. We will assess the impact and see it can be fixed. Meanwhile if you have the fix for this please contribute back to this project we greatly appreciate it. rvema
499621189 @bargemb do you have this running on your local machine or on a seperate box? Also I see that you are using ip address is there any reason why you cant use localhost? rvema
499634713 I am running this on our internal server.

I have now switched to dockerized setup and default ports are working properly now. Currently it's not blocker issue for me although I would suggest to keep this issue open. 

Nothing specific about the IP address. Would it cause any issues ? bargemb
499637721 Core policy is quite strict, both port and server must match. I know I had a ton of problems trying to “just” run it all locally... hence setting up an quick reverse proxy using apache, but Nginx works too... and it’s all handled in the docker containers. But there is no magic here... if you want to piece it all together you’ll have to deal with the cors aspect (and rightly so... don’t be tempted to just allow cors... too risky) stevegal
499662452 closing this issue as it was solved. rvema
499666207 @rvema the issue with local setup (without using docker and reverse proxy) is not yet solved.  bargemb
499676508 Different browsers have different restrictions on local host cors policy. You could add allow headers in the api, but that could open up a serious misconfiguration attack vector to the casual user. Although I’ve no involvement in this project other than believing this is such an important tool, I don’t think it would be wise to workaround the cors issue out of the box. It’s there to protect the end user. stevegal

column2:
I have created a new Jira cloud trial account. In the hygieia documentation username:password(encoded in base64) is mentioned for collector authentication. I am trying to authorize Jira with collector using email:password(encoded in base64) format but it's not working.  

I searched on the internet and found that Jira has already removed username field from Jira.

https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2018/06/say-goodbye-to-usernames-in-atlassian-cloud?_ga=2.159559613.184535873.1559202112-814553513.1559113992.

I tried to hit the API using postman with email:password and also bypassing basic auth key in header. but it's not working there also.


I am not sure with the issue, But I have a prod instance of Jira, Where older user can able to login using username:password but new users are getting 401.

@Sbrenthughes 

We are using bitbucket stash version 4.1.4. I am not sure if we need to generate repo key and how to generate it. i dont see any errors or auth issue but still it is not pulling any metrics from stash.

Bitbucket application.properties:
# Database Port - default is 27017
dbport=27017

# MongoDB replicaset
#dbreplicaset=[false if you are not using MongoDB replicaset]
#dbhostport=[host1:port1,host2:port2,host3:port3]
# Database Name
dbname=dashboarddb

# Database HostName - default is localhost
dbhost=********
# Database Username - default is blank
dbusername=dashboarduser

# Database Password - default is blank
dbpassword=****

# Logging File location
logging.file=./logs/bitbucket.log

# Collector schedule (required)
git.cron=0 0/5 * * * *

# Mandatory parameters
git.host=http://****/rest/api/1.0/
git.api=/rest/api/1.0/

# Maximum number of days to go back in time when fetching commits
git.commitThresholdDays=15

# Page size for rest calls
#   Only applicable to Bitbucket Server.
#   Only applicable to Bitbucket Cloud.
git.pageSize=25

# Bitbucket product
# Set to 'cloud' to use Bitbucket Cloud (formerly known as Bitbucket)
# Set to 'server' to use Bitbucket Server (formerly known as Stash)
# More information can be found here:   
        https://github.com/capitalone/Hygieia/issues/609
        git.product=server

# Bitbucket key for private repos
 bitbucket.key=<your-generated-key>

497759166 @ajayakumar-jayaraj Looking at your log my guess is that you git.host is wrong. Git host should be proper bitbucket server url.

> Wrong
git.host=http://****/rest/api/1.0/


example config,
```java
git.host=https://bitbucket.server.com/
git.api=/rest/api/1.0/
git.username=bitbucket_user
git.password=secret
```
Also you can verify bitbucket rest api in postman or any other rest client,
example url - https://bitbucket.server.com/rest/api/1.0/projects/my_project/repos/my_repo/commits?until=master&since=a_long_commit_hash&limit=20

498373239 @ajayakumar-jayaraj   The current implementation is using the username/password(encrypted) from the repo widget configuration. 

https://github.com/Hygieia/Hygieia/blob/40b4242e2740b3b0bbc4aba4aaabb087e99dcbff/collectors/scm/bitbucket/src/main/java/com/capitalone/dashboard/collector/DefaultBitbucketServerClient.java#L72-L90


I have enhanced it to consider global credentials for cases where repo specific credential is missing.
https://github.com/Hygieia/Hygieia/pull/2678/files#diff-9bb51a759b60fb0dbc004798bba7a269R28
This change is part of my open PR: https://github.com/Hygieia/Hygieia/pull/2678

As a workaround, can you try configuring username and password in the repo widget configuration?

```bash

498819562 @ajayakumar-jayaraj This is great that you make rest api call through curl command. It seems like the encryption mechanism you are using is incorrect.
 Can you please use [Encryption.java](https://github.com/Hygieia/hygieia-core/blob/ae115fa6659643641e8221e0713dd66d2d554e09/src/main/java/com/capitalone/dashboard/util/Encryption.java) to generate an encryption key and use that to encrypt your secret. You will use configure this encrypted key with git.key=someLongKey.
For example when I execute Encryption.java then I get this output,
```
Your secret key is:
/oZFLKeRgxMBhrxAhm7mUjjB5T37tXNr
Sample encrypted string with the above key for 'thisIsMyPassword' is:
AdshEXW4j/AJW1Uh8fNdGKIIzn+HBcmM
```
Here key is  `/oZFLKeRgxMBhrxAhm7mUjjB5T37tXNr`
and encrypted password is `AdshEXW4j/AJW1Uh8fNdGKIIzn+HBcmM` 

With this data as an example, you can configure,
``` git.key=/oZFLKeRgxMBhrxAhm7mUjjB5T37tXNr ```

Please ensure that you configure repo widget with encrypted value as described above.  shishirchaturvedi

2019-06-06 11:20:01,306 ERROR c.c.d.c.DefaultBitbucketServerClient - Failed to obtain commits from https://****:7999/rest/api/1.0/projects/ms/repos/microservices/commits?until=master&limit=20
org.springframework.web.client.ResourceAccessException: I/O error on GET request for "https://***:7999/rest/api/1.0/projects/ms/repos/microservices/commits?until=master&limit=20": Unrecognized SSL message, plaintext connection?; nested exception is javax.net.ssl.SSLException: Unrecognized SSL message, plaintext connection?
	at org.springframework.web.client.RestTemplate.doExecute(RestTemplate.java:607) ~[spring-web-4.2.5.RELEASE.jar!/:4.2.5.RELEASE]
	at org.springframework.web.client.RestTemplate.execute(RestTemplate.java:572) ~[spring-web-4.2.5.RELEASE.jar!/:4.2.5.RELEASE]
	at org.springframework.web.client.RestTemplate.exchange(RestTemplate.java:493) ~[spring-web-4.2.5.RELEASE.jar!/:4.2.5.RELEASE] ajayakumar-jayaraj
499562190 @ajayakumar-jayaraj I see two issues here.
**1. Encryption Key is not used for both encryption and decryption:** Please configure SCM collector to use Encryption Key which you have used to encrypt your password. This you can ensure by providing your encryption key when encrypting a secret.
**2. Bitbucket server is sending response over HTTP:** I see an exception with a message `Unrecognized SSL message, plaintext connection`. This means that Bitbucket server is sending response over HTTP. Reference: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/6532273/unrecognized-ssl-message-plaintext-connection-exception
In Hygieia, can you configure Bitbucket to use with HTTP instead of HTTPS if your server is not configured for HTTPS?
 shishirchaturvedi
499588504 @shishirchaturvedi 

 1)  it is getting expiring or failing to use the git.key/encrypted Password after 30 minutes, any runs within 30 mins are successful after the password update on widget.

2) our stash end point is http 



# Mandatory parameters
git.host=stash.***
git.api=/rest/api/1.0/
#git.userId=
#git.password= ajayakumar-jayaraj
499596391 @ajayakumar-jayaraj It is strange that Bitbucket collector is unable to decrypt credentials after 30 mins. I don't see any reason why it is behaving that way. Encryption keys in Hygieia are loaded at startup time. There is no reason why it should reset the encryption key. 
One possibility is that somehow encrypted password, which is stored in Hygieia MongoDB, is getting changed/updated.
Can you enable DEBUG log level so that you can get a detailed log of what is going on, 
```
logging.level.com.capitalone.dashboard.collector=DEBUG
logging.level.org.springframework=DEBUG
``` shishirchaturvedi
499634308 @shishirchaturvedi yes I agree , encrypted password is getting changed with 30 min duration. ajayakumar-jayaraj
499649526 @shishirchaturvedi pls see attached log file

499651801 @ajayakumar-jayaraj I don't see log file link. shishirchaturvedi
499652042 @shishirchaturvedi Pls check now ajayakumar-jayaraj
499656839 @ajayakumar-jayaraj I didn't find anything suspicious in the log file. Bitbucket calls are getting 200 response. 
Anyways, can you pull the latest source code of Hygieia? My PR was merged recently and it will allow you to use global Bitbucket password in the application.properties file. So after pulling latest code, you can configure Bitbucket username/password as,
```
git.username=username
git.password=encryptedPassword
git.key=encryptionKey
```
 shishirchaturvedi

499893129 @shishirchaturvedi yes I took the latest code. I am using the same key and credentials which was working before . one bug i see it is pulling the old credentials which should not be used  , it is not getting the credential hardcoded in the application.properties . i believe if we update the credentials it shd overwrite the older one. Please looks into asap. it is completely broken now.  ajayakumar-jayaraj
499904943 @ajayakumar-jayaraj Current implementation works like this,
1. If repo credentials are configured in repo config widget then it is given priority.
2. When repo credentials are missing in config widget then use globally configured credentials.
https://github.com/Hygieia/Hygieia/blob/master/collectors/scm/bitbucket/src/main/java/com/capitalone/dashboard/collector/SCMHttpRestClient.java#L34-L38
3. If no credentials are configured(repo config/globally) then make Rest API call without credentials.

When you said SCM collector is picking up old credentials, I suspect that you still have userID/password in the repo config. There is no other way Hygieia will have knowledge about old credentials. 
Looking forward to more input on this. 
 shishirchaturvedi

column2:
Hi Team,
i am doing a POC by deploying hygieia in 

[api.txt](https://github.com/Hygieia/Hygieia/files/3236885/api.txt)

kubernetes cluster in google cloud.
in brief,i have cloned the master branch and built API/UI and imported mongo db image from open source and created the dashboard db.

here are the list of issues i have encountered :
1) UI is not getting connected to API
2) i am not getting any response from API while using below url : 
a) http://api-service:8080/api/appinfo 
b) http://api-service:8080/api/swagger/index.html
c)  http://api-service:8080/ping --> this works
ran these commands from both inside the container as well as from the service which was exposed to outside 
errors : 
vishal_devops_2019@gke-test-default-pool-6cbf8333-bp45 ~ $ docker exec -ti e6143272df5d        sh
# curl http://localhost:8080/api/swagger/index.html                     
{"timestamp":1559216908570,"status":404,"error":"Not Found","message":"No message available","path":"/api/swagger/index.html"}# 
# curl http://localhost:3000/api/swagger/index.html
curl: (7) Failed to connect to localhost port 3000: Connection refused
# netstat -ntlp
Active Internet connections (only servers)
Proto Recv-Q Send-Q Local Address           Foreign Address         State       PID/Program name    
tcp6       0      0 :::8080                 :::*                    LISTEN      8/java              
# curl http://localhost:8080/ping
true# 
# curl http://localhost:8080/api/appinfo
{"timestamp":1559217242537,"status":404,"error":"Not Found","message":"No message available","path":"/api/appinfo"}# 

after deploying UI and exposing the service, i am not able to move further as the API connectivity is not happening and the inspect logs are pointing to the UI ip.
i have changed the default and conf-builder file by mapping the api service name but still iyt's not working.

can anyone please provide the solution. attached the API & UI logs
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16570454/58631586-abf96e00-8300-11e9-9d04-dfc80fcc4644.png)


[UI.txt](https://github.com/Hygieia/Hygieia/files/3236886/UI.txt)
Regards,
vishal
column5: Hygieia deployment in K8 in google cloud
column10:
497366734 You have a configuration issue first off. The UI looks at /api/*. However, `curl http://localhost:8080/ping` works, which’s means your configuration is wrong. It should be `curl http://localhost:8080/api/ping`. What does your api properties look like? Sbrenthughes
497389838 @Sbrenthughes you mean properties-builder.sh file 


[properties-builder.txt](https://github.com/Hygieia/Hygieia/files/3237846/properties-builder.txt)
 vishalbisa
497391479 Ah I see. Can you add `server.contextPath=/api` to it? Sbrenthughes
497392434 let me give a try , i will let you know once i re-build the docker image and redeploy in the K8.
 vishalbisa
497443736 @Sbrenthughes  Thanks it worked, but still i dont see the `server.contextpath=/api` in master branch.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16570454/58656646-53df5d80-833a-11e9-8904-7d9a128c11fa.png)
 vishalbisa
497443997 @Sbrenthughes can you please check the issue #2804  vishalbisa
497754744 @vishalbisa unfortunately I am not familiar with that aspect of hygieia yet.  Sbrenthughes

column5: Help with Artifactory
column10:
496600594 What command are you using to run it? Sbrenthughes
496610592 java -jar ./target/artifactory-artifact-collector-3.0.2-SNAPSHOT.jar --spring.config.name=artifactory --spring.config.location=./artifactory.properties fldadof5
499505173 @fldadof5  Modify properties as below 

artifactory.cron=* * * * * *
artifactory.endpoint=artifactory/
artifactory.servers[0].username=
artifactory.servers[0].apiKey=
artifactory.servers[0].url=

artifactory.servers[0].repoAndPatterns[0].repo=prerelease
artifactory.servers[0].repoAndPatterns[0].patterns[0]= patterns for prerelease

artifactory.servers[0].repoAndPatterns[1].repo=release
artifactory.servers[0].repoAndPatterns[1].patterns[0]= patterns for release

 nireeshT

column2:
Hygieia allows any unauthenticated user to view the dashboard list without login first.
We want only authenticated users to view any data on hygieia dashboards otherwise users should be redirected to login page first.
column5: Hygieia dashboard view for only authenticated users
column10:
496585897 What is the issue with anyone being able to view dashboards? Sbrenthughes
496695449 We have to implement RBAC to view dashboards. So only authenticated users can view dashboards that they are authorized for. rstmna
498505954 @rstmna This feature is not available currently and we have not received enough requests for such a need. However since this is specific to your needs you are free to make modifications to the source code per your needs and use it.  rvema

column2: Look up tries to use the collectorItemId which causes a null pointer when enabling the score widget and configuring the Feature widget. Updated to look up by the collectorId.
column5: Fixes: #2929

column2:
address issue #2908 

This stems from when I moved to the visitor pattern to pick up the test results instead of specifying the result type on the UI. I left the boilerplate code for `testResultType` in the Step.
column5: remove unused `testResultType` from collector. Fixes issue #2908

column2:
@tabladrum @Sbrenthughes @nireeshT @satishc1 
I was using Hygieia v3.0.1 and had issues trying to get the Bitbucket collector from pulling commit history from a private repository. I did follow all the documentation. My dashboard consisted of Monitor (green - which showed that it was able to connect to my Bitbucket instance) and repo which was failing to collect the commits. The Bitbucket log showed that the request was returning a 401. When I tried to curl the same API using my Personal Access Token, I successfully got back all the commits. This could only mean that something was fiddling with my Personal Access Token that led to me getting a 401. I then stumbled upon the issue https://github.com/Hygieia/Hygieia/pull/2919 which suggests that the Personal Access Token is getting decrypted which is wrong. I have now freshly cloned the latest Hygieia repository and when I tried to build it, it failed. 

_**Note:** I have not re-built hygieia-core as I had built it earlier before building Hygieia v3.0.1_

494824126 I would suggest running mvn clean install on core and then trying again. Looks like the current version of bitbucket collector only takes username and password. I will check the PR that is outstanding to see if it has the updates. 

Looks like the current PR only takes username and password as well. So I am not sure how you got information with the access token from the UI. Once we get https://github.com/Hygieia/Hygieia/pull/2678 worked out then we can work on adding token authentication.  Sbrenthughes

column2:
Hi Team,

I am trying to up UI, API, DB and Jenkins Build Collector in docker-compose setup.

I have cloned the hygiea repositories and executed maven commands for building the required jar files.

Then modified the docker.compose.yml file like below.
version: '3'
services:
  db:
    image: mongo:latest
    ports:
      - "27017:27017"
    volumes:
      - "db-data:/data/db"

  db-setup:
    build: db
    depends_on:
      - db

  api:
    build: api
    image: hygieia-api
    depends_on:
      - db-setup
    ports:
      - "8080:8080"

  ui:
    build: UI
    image: hygieia-ui
    depends_on:
      - api
    ports:
      - "3000:80"

  jenkins-build-collector:
    build: collectors/build/jenkins
    image: hygieia-jenkins-build-collector
    depends_on:
      - db-setup

volumes:
  db-data:
  certs:

And modified the docker-compose.override.yml
version: '3'
services:
  api:
     # environment: # for a full list check the corresponding properties-builder file
     #   - DB_DATABASE: dashboarddb
     #   - DB_HOST: db
     #   - DB_PORT: 27017
     #   - DB_USERNAME: dashboarduser
     #   - DB_PASSWORD: dbpassword
     # volumes:
     #   - ./logs:/hygieia/logs

  ui:
    # environment:

  jenkins-build-collector:
    environment:
    - JENKINS_CRON=2 * * * * *
    - JENKINS_MASTER=http://my-jenkins-server
    - JENKINS_USERNAME=<api-user>
    - JENKINS_API_KEY=<my-api-key>

Error:
The build collector is not getting up and throws error as MONGO_PORT not defined.
column5: hygiea jenkins build collector is failing
column10:
493904409 you need to changes  in properties-builder.sh in api\docker\properties-builder.sh:
server.contextPath=/api
server.port=8080

and make sure your environment variable are same in both docker-compose file and properties-builder.sh.

-------------------------------
properties-builder.sh in jenkins:

#!/bin/bash

# mongo container provides the HOST/PORT
# api container provided DB Name, ID & P
cat > $PROP_FILE <<EOF
#Database Name
dbname=${DB_NAME:-dashboard}
#Database HostName - default is localhost
dbhost=${DB_HOST:-db}
#Database Port - defaultis 27017
dbport=${DB_PORT:-27017}
#Database Username - default is blank
dbusername=
#${HYGIEIA_API_ENV_SPRING_DATA_MONGODB_USERNAME:-dashboarduser}
#Database Password - default is blank
dbpassword=
#${HYGIEIA_API_ENV_SPRING_DATA_MONGODB_PASSWORD:-dbpassword}
#Collector schedule (required)
jenkins.cron=${JENKINS_CRON:-0 0/1 * * * *}
#The page size
jenkins.pageSize=${JENKINS_PAGE_SIZE:-1000}
# The folder depth - default is 10
jenkins.folderDepth=${JENKINS_FOLDER_DEPTH:-10}
#Jenkins server (required) - Can provide multiple
jenkins.servers[0]=${JENKINS_SERVER}
#jenkins.niceNames[0]=[YourJenkins]
#jenkins.environments[0]=[DEV,QA,INT,PERF,PROD]
#Another option: If using same username/password Jenkins auth - set username/apiKey to use HTTP Basic Auth (blank=no auth)
jenkins.usernames[0]=${JENKINS_USERNAME}
jenkins.apiKeys[0]=${JENKINS_APIKEY}
jenkins.searchFields[0]= options.jobName
jenkins.searchFields[1]= niceName
EOF

echo "
===========================================
Properties file created `date`:  $PROP_FILE
Note: passwords & apiKey hidden
===========================================
`cat $PROP_FILE |egrep -vi 'password|apiKey'`
"

exit 0


-----------
NOTE: also give execution permission to properties-builder.sh file using:
chmod +x \properties-builder.sh
 anayyadav
495362121 Please reopen if this doesn't solve the issue. Sbrenthughes

What I need this is to drag and change the order of the widgets or while creating the dashboard there needs to be an option to prioritize these widgets based on numbering.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22302511/58010535-2b6f8c00-7b0e-11e9-8789-9def86a9098f.png)
 anayyadav
494183513 @anayyadav I don't see this view at all in my hygieia. all i see is create a new dashboard and edit existing dashboards. I think,  I'm just a regular user of hygieia. how do i grant admin permissions ?  zerolaser
494255826 you can create a custom templates. 
you can go to above page by clicking on setting icon in top right of your screen.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22302511/58072906-c9229400-7bbe-11e9-9f13-15ab97e46cee.png)
 anayyadav
495361693 You can create the user `admin` and login using it to gain access to the admin user. Other than what @anayyadav suggested, you won't be able to do any more customization in this version of the UI. Once  the UI is upgraded to the latest version of Angular you will have more control. The upgrade is expected to start rolling out over the next few months.  Sbrenthughes

column2:
- Refactors DefaultBambooClient to execute Bamboo API calls in parallel batches
- Speeds up fetches for ~5k plans from 2 hours to <10 minutes (depending on network / server)
- Adds BambooAsyncFetch.java
- Parallel batch size configurable (default: 10)

Using the following application.properties  

```
# Database Name
dbname=dashboarddb
dbusername=hygieia
dbpassword=hygieiapassword
dbhost=localhost
dbport=27017
dbreplicaset=false
dbhostport=localhost:27017
logging.file=./logs/github.log
github.cron=0 0/1 * * * *

github.commitThresholdDays=45
github.errorThreshold=10
#github.key=<your-generated-key>
github.personalAccessToken=Mytoken
github.connectTimeout=2000
github.readTimeout=2000
```

column10:
493424902 U could configure only "n" number of private repo from a single profile. one private repo from one profile and another one from another profile cannot be configured at a time
 mitunmbj
493481897 First, You need `github.key=<your-generated-key>` to match the `key=<your-generated-key>` in your API properties. Can you paste your API properties? Sbrenthughes
493493236 https://github.com/Hygieia/Hygieia/pull/2919 should fix the decryption issue when passing the token from properties file. But it will not fix the configuration issue you have above.   Sbrenthughes
493546177 @Sbrenthughes What exactly is the github.key here ? 
I have the github personal access token.  Do I need to create a new OAUTH application use its client secret here ?  zerolaser
493546825 @mitunmbj not sure what you meant here. 
I'm using two github personal access token for two different repo's im configuring from UI. zerolaser
494008139 > @Sbrenthughes What exactly is the github.key here ?
> I have the github personal access token. Do I need to create a new OAUTH application use its client secret here ?

https://hygieia.github.io/Hygieia/collectors.html#encryption-for-private-repos

If you are trying to use `github.personalAccessToken=Mytoken` it will fail until you update to the latest. The PR was just merged.  Sbrenthughes
496993848 @zerolaser any update? Sbrenthughes
500831823 Close due to inactivity.  Sbrenthughes

column2: I am looking at the jenkins publisher plugin, does it currently support pushing individual stage information as well rather than environment flow? Lets say I have 10 stages in my jenkinsfile , I would like to publish each stage information whether it is successful or not.
column5: Jenkins Publisher Plugin
column10:
493119855 Yes you can something like this. Can you give more detail on the stages? You would use `hygieiaDeployPublishStep` But it is important to note that before you do this you must have a build stage that contains `hygieiaArtifactPublishStep` and the version and name must match in each deploy step Sbrenthughes
493129632 We have stages like the unit testing, contract testing, smoke testing, build artifacts etc, right the pipeline view only has environment view like DEV-->TEST-->PROD etc, I am thinking of using buildpublishstep in each one of these stages and change the values to success or failure depending on the result of that particular stage. Correct me if I am wrong vbottu
494010202 You don't need the build publish step in each stage if you have auto publish turned on. You'd only need `hygieiaDeployPublishStep` in each stage other than commit and build. In build you'd need  `hygieiaArtifactPublishStep` Sbrenthughes
498496335 @vbottu Have you tried adding `hygieiaDeployPublishStep` and `hygieiaArtifactPublishStep` to your pipeline? Please confirm if this is still an issue? rvema

column5: Gitlab feature collector not working properly
column10:
493072653 Are these the only environment variables you are passing?
```
environment:
- MONGO_PORT=27017
- MONGO_HOST=db
- GITLAB_CRON=0 * * * * *
- GITLAB_API_TOKEN=*****
```
You can take a look at https://github.com/Hygieia/Hygieia/blob/master/collectors/scm/gitlab/docker/properties-builder.sh and https://github.com/Hygieia/Hygieia/blob/gh-pages/pages/hygieia/collectors/scm/gitlab.md for more information and which values to pass. Sbrenthughes
493384984 Those are indeed the only environment variables I'm passing. The links you posted are of the GitLab SCM collector, I also use that and it's working collecting, but the issues I'm experiencing are with the GitLab Feature collector (used for grabbing scrum/kanban issues). Looking at 
https://github.com/Hygieia/Hygieia/blob/gh-pages/pages/hygieia/collectors/feature/feature-gitlab.md
the only required parameters that are needed are the ones I provided in my environments file. The collector is running and keeps trying to collect data, yet at the point where the issues should be collected the java nullexception pops up. MerlijnElderhuis
494313329 @Sbrenthughes do you have an idea about how to solve this issue? MerlijnElderhuis
494829999 Ah I apologize. Looks like the API being used is returning null. Do you no what version you are using? Sbrenthughes
494831871 I'm using the most recent version, just cloned it from GitHub. MerlijnElderhuis
495373455 @zhenweiding since you have experience with the gitlab SCM collector (gitlab APIs), do you think you could take a look at this? It has to do with the feature portion of GitLab. Sbrenthughes
496082272 @MerlijnElderhuis There is my gitlab feature's configure in "docker-compose.yml":

  gitlab-feature-collector:
    build: collectors/feature/gitlab
    image: hygieia-gitlab-feature-collector
    volumes:
      - /Users/dingzhenwei/devops/Hygieia-3.0.1/logs:/hygieia/logs
      - /Users/dingzhenwei/devops/Hygieia-3.0.1/config:/hygieia/config
    environment:
      - MONGO_DATABASE=dashboarddb
      - **MONGO_PORT=tcp://db:27017**
      - MONGO_USERNAME=******
      - MONGO_PASSWORD=******
      - GITLAB_HOST=gitlab.com
      - GITLAB_PROTOCOL=https
      - GITLAB_PORT=443
      - GITLAB_CRON=0 */15 * * * *
      - GITLAB_API_TOKEN=******
      - GITLAB_COMMIT_THRESHOLD_DAYS=20
      - SKIP_PROPERTIES_BUILDER=false
    depends_on:
      - db-setup

I think the point is the [**MONGO_PORT**]'s value, please try again with the correct config value. zhenweiding
496217380 @zhenweiding Thanks for the quick response, that seemed to have fixed it! MerlijnElderhuis

column2:
Hey guys,

I've been setting up Hygieia for a while, and I've got a weird behavior on Product Dashboard. I've four widgets working properly. They're:
Code Repo: Bitbucket Collector
Build: Jenkins-Build Collector
Code Analysis: SonarQube and Jenkins-Cucumber Collectors
Deploy: Hygieia Publisher Plugin

My problem is on Product Dashboard. The dashboard is showing up the commit blocks, and I can see the commits moving from one environment to the other. However, I'm stuck in a problem.

Let's say that I've one commit sitting in DEV stage and one commit sitting in QA stage. Each commit represents a different version of my app (I've double checked on database, and they're different). If I run the deployPublisher to deploy into STG, both commits move to STG rather than only the commit sitting on QA (again, same application but different versions).

Btw, my flow is COMMIT -> BUILD -> DEV -> QA -> STG -> PRD

Am I missing something here?
column5: Commit transition - Product Dashboard
column10:
492846805 This is a known issue to which we are stilling working out the best solution. The ideal setup is that that a user has enough automated testing for a to commit progresses through all stages in single run. But simply won't be the case for the majority of apps. I will respond here when we have a solution.  Sbrenthughes
493091708 Thanks for the quick reply @Sbrenthughes 
Are you guys currently working on this issue or it's in your backlog? When are you planning to release it? caiohcl
498496598 @caiohcl We currently do not have an ETA for this fix, if you have bandwidth please contribute back to the project by implementing the fix. rvema

column2:
I am trying to connect to the internal bitbucket server and the connection is successful from the collector but the query url to fetch the commits is causing problem , it throwing 404  ERROR c.c.d.c.DefaultBitbucketCloudClient - 404 on the endpoint commits?sha=master&since=2019-05-15T19:44Z, Please see the exception in the image attached. I am not sure if the query url being built by the default bitbucket cloud client is right
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19859827/57805201-110a6c80-7722-11e9-95c2-0d08b5d64ab7.png)
column5: BitBucket Collector Issue with api 1.0
column10:
493020942 @shishirchaturvedi Can you provide some help here since you have a lot knowledge with that collector? Sbrenthughes
493101100 @vbottu Please see this [REST specification document](https://docs.atlassian.com/bitbucket-server/rest/5.13.1/bitbucket-rest.html#idm45902677006336). The search parameter `Since` should be a valid commit.
Since - the commit ID or ref (exclusively) to retrieve commits after.
You have used a date rather than a commitId. This is also highlighted in the error response you have received from BitBucket server.
 shishirchaturvedi
493112574 @shishirchaturvedi thank you, i was using the wrong bitbucket type. vbottu
493116456 @shishirchaturvedi I appreciate you help here! Thank you!
 Sbrenthughes

Removes the requirement for the properties to use:
```
feature.jiraStoryIds[0]=
feature.jiraEpicId=
```

Now the collector only relies on `feature.jiraIssueTypeNames=` to have the issue type names in a comma separated string as usual.

column2:
Problem:

Currently the Jira collector forces the user to make a manual API call to look up the Issuetype Ids and then insert them into the properties file. Ideally the collector should handle this.

Solution:
Update the Jira collector to auto populate the issue type ids using the API `https://[your-jira-domain-name]/rest/api/2/issuetype`
column5: Jira Collector Needs to Auto Populate Issue IDs

column2:
I have the Jira collector connecting to my Jira Cloud instance and pulling in the correct list of teams (boards) and scopes (projects).  However, it only collects a few features, with the result that I can't find any board to test a widget and get numbers besides 0 0 0.  I'm sure I've done something wrong.

If it helps, this is a pretty big Jira instance.  There are 568 boards and 280 projects showing in MongoDb.  I see 134 features (all Story) but if I query Jira like this:

Sprint in openSprints() and issuetype = story

I see 3272 items.

I've attached my collector props file with Jira URL/creds taken out.  I've also tried upping the max per board from 10 to 100 with no effect.
[application.properties.txt](https://github.com/Hygieia/Hygieia/files/3170688/application.properties.txt)
column5: Jira collector only collects a few stories
column10:
491638766 Also, here's a short log sample.  After the first time through (where it gets 134 items total), everything looks like this:

2019-05-12 19:37:36,385 INFO  c.c.d.collector.FeatureCollectorTask - Collecting 262 of 568 boards.
2019-05-12 19:37:37,136 INFO  c.c.d.collector.CollectorTask - Story Data Collected since 2019-05-12T19:29:36.946 0      217s
2019-05-12 19:37:37,137 INFO  c.c.d.collector.FeatureCollectorTask - Collecting 263 of 568 boards.
2019-05-12 19:37:37,994 INFO  c.c.d.collector.CollectorTask - Story Data Collected since 2019-05-12T19:29:37.638 0      217s
2019-05-12 19:37:37,996 INFO  c.c.d.collector.FeatureCollectorTask - Collecting 264 of 568 boards.
2019-05-12 19:37:38,793 INFO  c.c.d.collector.CollectorTask - Story Data Collected since 2019-05-12T19:29:38.475 0      218s freecellwiz
491817144 `feature.collectorItemOnlyUpdate=true` is used when you want to pull based on only Hygieia dashboards that are configured with the feature widget. Otherwise it will pull all jira boards.

`feature.maxNumberOfFeaturesPerBoard` Should not be less than a few hundred or even 1000. This limit is only in place because sometimes boards have thousands of items attached and it causes latency issues. 

To your question above, the first time the board pulls it will try to pull every story that it can. After that it only pulls based on the last time that jira board was collected against. Try creating a new story and moving it to in progress. You should see it update in the logs.  Sbrenthughes
491890565 Thanks Brent.  So:

- for collectorItemOnlyUpdate, "true" setting failed for me because there weren't any widgets set up, so it didn't bring back any boards.  Since widget config is done using the populated list of projects and boards, it seems like it *has* to be "false" so users have something to pick.
- for maxNumberOfFeatures - I will update to 1000.  

I still don't see why it doesn't initially pull all stories in current sprints.  The JQL I ran showed thousand of stories in open sprints across the org.  I can't find a pattern as to which items are collected and which aren't.  Are there any common errors in config that cause this?

Right now my goal is just to see a widget, any widget, that shows non-zero/empty Jira data. freecellwiz
492251253 > * for collectorItemOnlyUpdate, "true" setting failed for me because there weren't any widgets set up, so it didn't bring back any boards.  Since widget config is done using the populated list of projects and boards, it seems like it _has_ to be "false" so users have something to pick.

The Jira Collector doesn't work like this. Only issues are impacted by `collectorItemOnlyUpdate`. Projects and boards/teams pull by default. So you can configure the widget before it collects more data. 


> I still don't see why it doesn't initially pull all stories in current sprints. The JQL I ran showed thousand of stories in open sprints across the org. I can't find a pattern as to which items are collected and which aren't. Are there any common errors in config that cause this?

Are all the stories actually of issue type `Story`? Since they didn't pull with `collectorItemOnlyUpdate=false` I suspect not. For now you need to add the issue types here `feature.jiraIssueTypeNames=` and their ids `feature.jiraStoryIds[]=`.  We will be making an enhancment soon where the need for `feature.jiraStoryIds[]` and `feature.jiraEpicId` will go away.  Sbrenthughes
494009552 @freecellwiz any update there? Sbrenthughes
500131044 closing issue due to inactivity rvema

column10:
491337346 Properties file

server.contextPath=/jira
server.port=8082

# Database Name
dbname=dashboarddb

# Database HostName - default is localhost
dbhost=localhost

# Database Port - default is 27017
dbport=27017

# MongoDB replicaset
dbreplicaset=[false if you are not using MongoDB replicaset]
dbhostport=[host1:port1,host2:port2,host3:port3]

# Database Username - default is blank
dbusername=dashboarduser

# Database Password - default is blank
dbpassword=dbpassword

# Logging File location
logging.file=./logs/jira.log

# PageSize - Expand contract this value depending on Jira implementation's
# default server timeout setting (You will likely receive a SocketTimeoutException)
feature.pageSize=100

# Delta change date that modulates the collector item task
# Occasionally, these values should be modified if database size is a concern
feature.deltaStartDate=2016-03-01T00:00:00.000000
feature.masterStartDate=2016-03-01T00:00:00.000000
feature.deltaCollectorItemStartDate=2016-03-01T00:00:00.000000

# Chron schedule: S M D M Y [Day of the Week]
feature.cron=0 * * * * *

# ST Query File Details - Required, but DO NOT MODIFY
feature.queryFolder=jiraapi-queries
feature.storyQuery=story
feature.epicQuery=epic

# JIRA CONNECTION DETAILS:
# Enterprise Proxy - ONLY INCLUDE IF YOU HAVE A PROXY
#feature.jiraProxyUrl=
#feature.jiraProxyPort=
feature.jiraBaseUrl=https://myjira.site.net
feature.jiraQueryEndpoint=rest/api/2/
# For basic authentication, requires username:password as string in base64
# This command will make this for you:  echo -n username:password | base64

feature.jiraCredentials=emailID:Password

# OAuth is not fully implemented; please blank-out the OAuth values:

feature.jiraOauthAuthtoken=
feature.jiraOauthRefreshtoken=
feature.jiraOauthRedirecturi=
feature.jiraOauthExpiretime=

#############################################################################
# In Jira, general IssueType IDs are associated to various 'issue'
# attributes. However, there is one attribute which this collector's
# queries rely on that change between different instantiations of Jira.
# Please provide a string name reference to your instance's IssueType for
# the lowest level of Issues (for example, 'user story') specific to your Jira
# instance.  Note:  You can retrieve your instance's IssueType Name
# listings via the following URI:  https://[your-jira-domain-name]/rest/api/2/issuetype/
# Multiple comma-separated values can be specified.
#############################################################################
feature.jiraIssueTypeNames=Story

#############################################################################
# In Jira, your instance will have its own custom field created for 'sprint' or 'timebox' details,
# which includes a list of information.  This field allows you to specify that data field for your
# instance of Jira. Note: You can retrieve your instance's sprint data field name
# via the following URI, and look for a package name com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.sprint.Sprint;
# your custom field name describes the values in this field:
# https://[your-jira-domain-name]/rest/api/2/issue/[some-issue-name]
#############################################################################
feature.jiraSprintDataFieldName=customfield_10000

#############################################################################
# In Jira, your instance will have its own custom field created for 'super story' or 'epic' back-end ID,
# which includes a list of information.  This field allows you to specify that data field for your instance
# of Jira.  Note:  You can retrieve your instance's epic ID field name via the following URI where your
# queried user story issue has a super issue (for example, epic) tied to it; your custom field name describes the
# epic value you expect to see, and is the only field that does this for a given issue:
# https://[your-jira-domain-name]/rest/api/2/issue/[some-issue-name]
#############################################################################
feature.jiraEpicIdFieldName=customfield_10002

#############################################################################
# In Jira, your instance will have its own custom field created for 'story points'
# This field allows you to specify that data field for your instance
# of Jira.  Note:  You can retrieve your instance's storypoints ID field name via the following URI where your
# queried user story issue has story points set on it; your custom field name describes the
# story points value you expect to see:
# https://[your-jira-domain-name]/rest/api/2/issue/[some-issue-name]
#############################################################################
feature.jiraStoryPointsFieldName=customfield_10003

#############################################################################
# In Jira, your instance will have its own custom field created for 'team'
# This field allows you to specify that data field for your instance
# of Jira.  Note:  You can retrieve your instance's team ID field name via the following URI where your
# queried user story issue has team set on it; your custom field name describes the
# team value you expect to see:
# https://[your-jira-domain-name]/rest/api/2/issue/[some-issue-name]
#############################################################################
feature.jiraTeamFieldName=

#############################################################################
# In Jira, your instance will have its own Id for the issueTypes. 
# You can retrieve the issueType IDs from the following API request:
# https://[your-jira-domain-name]/rest/api/2/issuetype
#############################################################################
feature.jiraStoryIds[0]=
feature.jiraStoryIds[1]=

#############################################################################
# In Jira, your instance will have its own Id for the Epic
# You can find the value from the following API request:
# https://[your-jira-domain-name]/rest/api/2/issuetype
#############################################################################
feature.jiraEpicId=

# Defines how to update features per board. If true then only update based on enabled collectorItems otherwise full update
#feature.collectorItemOnlyUpdate=true

#Defines the maximum number of features allow per board. If limit is reach collection will not happen for given board
feature.maxNumberOfFeaturesPerBoard=100

# Set this to true if you use boards as team
feature.jiraBoardAsTeam=true AbhiAuto

column2:
Problem: When attempting to rehome to a new MongoDB, it fails to authenticate. Sniffer capture shows it is not using the `admin` DB in Mongo to authenticate, rather it is trying to auth against the DB where Hygieia will be storing its data.

Relevant log excerpt:
```
[{address=REDACTED:27021, type=UNKNOWN, state=CONNECTING, exception={com.mongodb.MongoSecurityException: Exception authenticating MongoCredential{mechanism=SCRAM-SHA-1, userName='REDACTED', source='REDACTED_DB_NAME', password=<hidden>, mechanismProperties={}}}, caused by {com.mongodb.MongoCommandException: Command failed with error 18: 'Authentication failed.' on server REDACTED:27021. The full response is { "ok" : 0.0, "errmsg" : "Authentication failed.", "code" : 18, "codeName" : "AuthenticationFailed", 
```

... where `REDACTED_DB_NAME` is the name of the DB that Hygieia will store its data, should it be able to auth... which is the same DB I see in the sniffer caps it is trying to perform initial auth to, instead of `admin`.

I have connected to the same Mongo cluster with the same creds - though using the `admin` DB to auth, of course - and it works fine.

I did try changing some of the Spring Boot config relevant to this (e.g.: `spring.data.mongodb.authentication-database=admin`), but no joy.

Is there something I'm missing here, or is the code hardwired to assume that the user lives in Hygieia's DB, instead of `admin`?
column5: Unable to get services to auth against "admin" DB in Mongo; uses Hygieia's DB, instead
column10:
489764934 I should mention that I can take the same setup and point it to a single-box Mongo where I added the user per the directions (e.g.: user lives in the same DB as Hygieia's data) and that works fine. cjchand
489785690 @cjchand Can you help me understand what is your requirement? rvema
489805388 @rvema Sure!

It is very common practice in Mongo to build users in the `admin` DB, not the DB where the data lives. This means when you go to authenticate to Mongo, you do so against the `admin` DB and not the DB for Hygieia. 

In fact, there is a Spring property for this: [spring.data.mongodb.authentication-database](https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/1.3.0.RELEASE/reference/html/common-application-properties.html).

What I'm asking for is the ability to specify what DB to auth against. I tried setting `spring.data.mongodb.authentication-database=admin` in my application.properties, but it ignored that setting.

Hope that helps! cjchand
498497900 @cjchand Have you tried using `dbname=dashboarddb` in your properties? rvema
498772733 @rvema Yes, it works if I add my account to the Hygieia DB itself. However, this is not standard practice for many MongoDB installs.

Instead, all users - regardless of the DB(s) they use - are typically added to the `admin` DB, then granted rights to the DB(s) they need to access. In fact, [MongoDB stores all users in the admin DB regardless of what DB you create the account in](https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/core/security-users/#centralized-user-data).

So, the ask here is that there be a property to tell Hygieia services what DB to auth against. You can default it to the same DB Hygieia uses (`dashboarddb`, etc), but give users the ability to specify a different DB solely for auth, if needed. Again, there is a [Spring property for this in the MongoDB class you are using](https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/1.3.0.RELEASE/reference/html/common-application-properties.html), just to reinforce that what I'm calling out here is indeed common.

Hope that clarifies. cjchand

It looks to me like it is getting a NullPointer when trying to read the username, but I am including it in the config file:

```
# Database Name
dbname=dashboarddb

# Database HostName - default is localhost
dbhost=my.db.ip.address

# Database Port - default is 27017
dbport=27017

# Database Username - default is blank
dbusername=dashboarduser

# Database Password - default is blank
dbpassword=dbpassword

# Collector schedule (required)
nexusiq.cron=0 0/5 * * * *

# Nexus IQ server(s) (required) - Can provide multiple
nexusiq.servers[0]=https://my.nexus.iq.url

# Nexus IQ username/password - with read-access to all reports, and so on.
nexusiq.username=myUsername
nexusiq.password=myPassword

logging.level.com.capitalone.dashboard.collector=DEBUG

#In case of multiple license violations for a given library, consider the strictest violation
nexusiq.selectStricterLicense=true
```

(I have replaced my urls, credentials, ips, etc. with placeholder values).

It looks like it is finding my properties file, as my NexusIQ url is correctly loaded, but it does not seem to be able to find the username for some reason. Am I configuring something incorrectly, or is there an issue with how the properties file is loaded in the collector?

```
nexusiq.usernames[0]=
nexusiq.password=
```

It seems to me that the syntax between how usernames and passwords are entered is very inconsistent. For usernames, it needed to be a list named `usernames`, while for password it needed to be a single value named `password`.

So, the current documentation that lists both properties as being pulled as lists seems to be incorrect. I would think that a short-term solution would be to update the documentation to list the properties that work (`nexusiq.usernames[0]` and `nexusiq.password`), and the permanent solution should be to find out why password is not being pulled as a list and update the code for the collector. It's not readily apparent to me why password isn't being pulled as a list from properties, but I'm not very familiar with the code. ewh0005
489074406 As for the build violations bit, at least in our organization Nexus IQ has three different categories for each app where violations are logged: Build, Stage Release, and Release. I'm not sure if that's a standard thing or just something in our company, but either way it makes sense that we're looking at the Build violations. 

Most of the apps in our organization either don't have violations or just Build violations, I just so happened to to be testing with one that only had Release violations. I don't know that this part is an issue moving forward, it's moreso the mismatched credential properties syntax. ewh0005
498639104 @Booma-Baskaran any thoughts? rvema
502054542 @rvema & @ewh0005 - As far as I know Nexus IQ Scan used to capture/scan open source vulnerabilities in an applications such as License, Security and Policy Alerts. Not sure, it can capture Build violations. Hygieia captures only open source vulnerabilities in an applications and not build violations or so. Booma-Baskaran

Configured application.properties as per the document - 

`
# Database Name
dbname=dashboarddb

# Database HostName - default is localhost
dbhost=127.0.0.1

# Database Port - default is 27017
dbport=27017

# MongoDB replicaset
dbreplicaset=false
dbhostport=127.0.0.1:27017

# Database Username - default is blank
dbusername=

# Database Password - default is blank
dbpassword=

# Collector schedule (required)
git.cron=0 0/1 * * * *

# Mandatory parameters
git.host=http://scm.******.com:<port>
git.api=/rest/api/1.0/

# Maximum number of days to go back in time when fetching commits
git.commitThresholdDays=15

# Page size for rest calls
#   Only applicable to Bitbucket Server.
#   Only applicable to Bitbucket Cloud.
git.pageSize=25

# Bitbucket product
#   Set to 'cloud' to use Bitbucket Cloud (formerly known as Bitbucket)
#   Set to 'server' to use Bitbucket Server (formerly known as Stash)
#   More information can be found here:
#   https://github.com/capitalone/Hygieia/issues/609
git.product=server

logging.level.com.capitalone.dashboard=INFO
logging.level.com.capitalone.dashboard.collector=INFO
logging.level.com.atlassian.git=INFO

# Bitbucket key for private repos
bitbucket.key=<Key Generated using Hygieia Core>
`

> respawn=true
> WorkingDirectory=/hygieia/api
>

column2:
Hi, We are looking for a custom collector that would fetch the data from Pivotal Cloud Foundry. Our requirement is to use the API endpoints similar to below to fetch details like  Version of application in each environment, status of services, application health, listener status, etc

1. Application version in each environment
API endpoint - http://<pcf-environment-url>/<application-name>/cloudfoundryapplication/info
RESPONSE - {"eureka":{"instance":{"metadata-map":{"user":{"password":"${eureka.instance.metadata-map.user.password}","name":"${eureka.instance.metadata-map.user.name}"}}},"UCD_Deployed_Version":"myApp-114"}}}

2. Application Health
API ENDPOINT - http://<pcf-environment-url>/<application-name>/cloudfoundryapplication/health 
RESPONSE - "hystrix":{"status":"UP"},"redis":{"status":"UP","details":{"version":"4.0.8"}}

3. Listener Status
API ENDPOINT - http://<pcf-environment-url>/<application-name>/admin/listenerStatus
RESPONSE - {"success":true,"messages":[],"responseBody":"['Listener': 'container', 'Active': 'true', 'Running': 'true', 'Active Consumers': '10']"}

Please let us know if this is feasible and any pointers to start with the custom collector. This would help us to monitor the applications closely on Hygieia dashboard. I appreciate any kind of help on this.
Thanks.
column5: Custom collector to fetch data from Pivotal Cloud Foundry
column10:
487677047 Here is some documentation to get started. You can then take a look at the github collector to see further example of how to create a collector. 
https://hygieia.github.io/Hygieia/create_collector.html Sbrenthughes

column2:
Hi,

I am trying to automate the dashboard creation using Hygieia API by making http://localhost:8080/api/dashboard/remoteCreate POST call. Below are the responses from swagger and Postman,

Swagger:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36442233/56682993-4e835900-6692-11e9-826d-d1cba80db044.png)

Postman:
I have generated the API Token using Admin menu and then did base64 encoding though I am getting 401 error,

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36442233/56683388-09abf200-6693-11e9-9cbd-108fd41872ba.png)

Thanks,
Booma Baskaran.
column5: Remote dashboard creation 401 Unauthorized error
column10:
486642141 Can you check if the admin token was created in the Mongo DB? rvema
486728510 Yes. 'apitoken' collection has the apiUser, apiKey and expirationDt. Booma-Baskaran
486783607 What command did you use to encode the token? Using `echo "PasswordIsAuthToken:{\"apiKey\":\"<your_token>\"}" | base64` should do it. Sbrenthughes
486791614 Nope. Using Base64 Encode in the Notepad++ by going to the Plugin commands option since I use Windows10.

![ApiToken-Base64Encoding](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36442233/56759962-c23f6780-675f-11e9-9eeb-1d731e4382c8.jpg)



 Booma-Baskaran
487054643 Can you try using `PasswordIsAuthToken:{"apiKey":"<your_token>"}` when you do this? The API requires this text be included with the token Sbrenthughes
487120086 Yes. I have done the same. I already have generated the apiToken by encoding PasswordIsAuthToken:{"apiKey":"<your_token>"} but still no luck. Is there any way to ignore apiToken? Booma-Baskaran
487143146 I am not sure why you would want insecure apis manipulating data? You could also try doing the java route for encoding https://hygieia.github.io/Hygieia/api.html#basic-authentication-for-secure-apis Sbrenthughes
488441431 @Booma-Baskaran Can you reach out to me on https://gitter.im/capitalone/Hygieia. I can work with you directly. Sbrenthughes
491829958 @Booma-Baskaran any update here? Sbrenthughes
492157706 @Sbrenthughes Bit busy on other priority items. Are you available by next week? What would be the good time to ping you in gitter? Booma-Baskaran
495373845 Reach out anytime  Sbrenthughes
502058800 @Sbrenthughes I fixed this by creating a simple java program with the steps mentioned in https://hygieia.github.io/Hygieia/api.html (Basic Authentication for Secure APIs section). After that, content-type with application/json header missing in the Postman call. Fixed it.

Now, I can able to make the Rest calls but I am not sure about the required input parameters. Can you please post here if you have any sample request parameters? Booma-Baskaran
