column2: Hi, I am using jenkins hygieia publisher plugin to push build and deploy data to Hygieia. I am able to see build data populated in Hygieia but not the deployment data. Request your help in resolving the issue.
column5: Jenkins Hygieia publisher is not pushing deployment data to Hygieia
column10:
486185815 Can you let me know the syntax you used in your pipeline code? rvema
486186653 I am using a freestyle job in Jenkins. I have configured all the parameters according to documentation available. Blessie7
486197745 Did you configure the plugin via Global settings in Jenkins? If so at this point we support build, sonar and custom reflex patterns for collectors. Can you post a screenshot of the configuration just to confirm if we are on the same page. rvema
486201242 Yes, I have configured the plugin on configure system page and the connection test on the endpoint was successful. Hence I was able to see build results in Hygieia. For sonar, I am using collector. We are not allowed to use API of UCD. So I want to go with the Jenkins Hygiea publisher for configuring deploy widget. 
Below is the configuration in Jenkins:
I have checked Publish deployment results and Publish Deploy start status.

Application Name: myapp
Environment Name: DEV
Artifact Directory: target
Artifact File Name Pattern: .zip
Artifact Group: org.mycompany
Artifact Version: 1.0-SNAPSHOT Blessie7
486534795 Here is the log in Jenkins
Hygieia: Automatically publishing build data to Hygieia using hygieia-publisher version 2.1.9-SNAPSHOT (private-ae661508-root), Please refresh your browser to see the status.
Hygieia: Auto Published Build Complete Data. Response Code: 201. 5cc04385f2896743bcfd11e7,5cc03ef4f2896743bcfd11e2
Hygieia: Auto Published Sonar Result. Nothing to publish
Hygieia: *** Hygieia publish completed in 0 seconds at 2019-04-24T07:07:49.107 ***

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20610136/56713663-f1e67380-674f-11e9-818e-441cec357e4c.png)


I don't see any UCD data being pushed to Hygieia in Jenkins console output. Please let me know if I am missing something. Blessie7
486646928 @Blessie7 The jenkins log output you have shown is from the auto configuration i.e. from Global preferences (This capability currently takes care of Build, Sonar and Custom Regex patterns). Can you search for other references of Hygieia in the jenkins log? rvema
486667760 I can see the logs of only build data being published. No traces of deployment data. Blessie7
486669681 I have checked the option to Publish Deployment Results. Not sure why Jenkins isn't pushing the results to Hygieia. 

I am not using udeploy collector. 

Please let me know if I need to do any additional configuration in Jenkins/Hygieia. Blessie7
486683817 I have found that if the global plugin is turned on you cannot use these steps. We will be looking into a quick fix for this.

> Here is the log in Jenkins
> Hygieia: Automatically publishing build data to Hygieia using hygieia-publisher version 2.1.9-SNAPSHOT (private-ae661508-root), Please refresh your browser to see the status.
> Hygieia: Auto Published Build Complete Data. Response Code: 201. 5cc04385f2896743bcfd11e7,5cc03ef4f2896743bcfd11e2
> Hygieia: Auto Published Sonar Result. Nothing to publish
> Hygieia: *** Hygieia publish completed in 0 seconds at 2019-04-24T07:07:49.107 ***
> 
> ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20610136/56713663-f1e67380-674f-11e9-818e-441cec357e4c.png)
> 
> I don't see any UCD data being pushed to Hygieia in Jenkins console output. Please let me know if I am missing something.

 Sbrenthughes
486690556 Thanks for your prompt response. So, in order to get the publisher plugin working, global settings should be disabled? I assume this is the settings in Configure System page on Jenkins, where we provide the Hygieia server url, UI url and auth token. Blessie7
486718424 Yes, that is correct. Another option is to switch to Jenkinsfile and use the publish steps. The global push could be left enabled doing this.  Sbrenthughes
486928542 @rvema @Sbrenthughes Thank you so much for your support. I am able to see the deployment data in Hygieia now. Blessie7
487005619 Hi,
Can anyone help me how to create properties file for hygieia jenkins collectors. Sample  properties would be a great help..

 mohanelango
487055070 @mohanelango Please open a new issue this one is not related to the collector. Sbrenthughes

486785247 What command are you running mongo with? And when you downgraded did you create a new db? Sbrenthughes
487153663 The first error (auth) got resolved as I believe it was related to where the property file needs to be placed.  Even though the property file that I had updated had dashboarddb, there was another property file saved in location hygieia/src/main/resources/, which has the dashboard as the db (which I don't recall putting one there but who knows after all the debugging changes...)

After the downgrade, I was able to purge the db so started fresh... 

For the second error, 
mongod - opens and wait for connection
mongo - i am able to connect to db and query 

But, when I do the, docker-compose up --force-recreate -d
The logs show the error noted in prior post.  

Couple of updates since then.... (incl above error)
1) Sonar collector - works and dashboard is able to show the data.
2) Jenkins collector - mongodb timeout - socket exception (log error below)
   - 2.1) why (or from where) is the mongodb_host being set to 27017, in property file its not set as such (verified)
   - 2.2) what should be the location for the application.properties file?
   - 2.3) I had reverted to mongo 3.4 version, so why is the mongo java driver version showing 3.0.2?  I updated the pom.xml in hygieia folder as follows but still same observation in logs:

  <properties>
    <spring-data-releasetrain.version>Gosling-RELEASE</spring-data-releasetrain.version>

    <!-- <mongodb.version>3.0.2</mongodb.version> -->
    <!-- <mongo>3.0.2</mongo> -->

    <mongodb.version>3.4.3</mongodb.version>
    <mongo>3.4.3</mongo>

    <spring.version>4.2.5.RELEASE</spring.version>
    <spring.cloud.version>1.3.1.RELEASE</spring.cloud.version>
    <jackson.version>2.5.0</jackson.version>

    <joda-convert.version>1.8.1</joda-convert.version>
    <docker.useConfigFile>false</docker.useConfigFile>
  </properties>


3) Feature JIRA collector - mongodb timeout - socket exception (log error below)
   - 3.1) why (or from where) is dbhost getting set to 27017, its not in the property file (verified)
   - 3.2) From docker log, it shows that its not picking the value from the application.properties file stored either at /hygieia/collectors/feature/jira/ or hygieia/collectors/feature/jira/src/main/resources/

column2:
Fixed issue where graphQL query returns an error that does not have the "type" field.

Fixed another issue where the queries are using the up to date repo url, but the query built is wrong because the GitHubParsed urls are not updated.   Subsequent runs are correct, but by updating it the first time, we can reduce the error messages.

column5: jira not fetching data
column10:
483257818 Please see the documentation. You are missing the epic id field and the story id field:https://github.com/Hygieia/Hygieia/blob/gh-pages/pages/hygieia/collectors/feature/jira.md Sbrenthughes
483534924 @Sbrenthughes if my Jira language is Chinese,there is  no Jira data in Hygieia.Can this issue be resolved? lyndomiao
484065240 For that issue we would need an external contributor to help.  Sbrenthughes
484071817 @Sbrenthughes I faced the same issue and by adding the epic id field and the story id, I get it to work.
you should update the application.properties in Jira collector with the below data for the people to not get confused:
feature.jiraStoryIds[0]=
feature.jiraStoryIds[1]=
feature.jiraEpicId=

Thanks yong86
484086098 @yong86 what should I search for when going to jira.com/rest/api/2/issueType 
either should i search for "story" then its representative ID...any idea... hvvit
484101961 @hvvit  let us say that you have two issue types called story & feature
what you will get from the api as below:
{"self":"http://localhost:8080/rest/api/2/issuetype/10200","id":"10200","description":"","iconUrl":"http://localhost:8080/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&avatarId=10300&avatarType=issuetype","name":"Feature","subtask":false,"avatarId":10300},
{"self":"http://localhost:8080/rest/api/2/issuetype/10001","id":"10001","description":"Created by Jira Software - do not edit or delete. Issue type for a user story.","iconUrl":"http://localhost:8080/images/icons/issuetypes/story.svg","name":"Story","subtask":false},

now, you add the below 
feature.jiraStoryIds[0]=10001
feature.jiraStoryIds[1]=10200

Hope it helps

Thanks
 yong86
484162051 > @Sbrenthughes I faced the same issue and by adding the epic id field and the story id, I get it to work.
> you should update the application.properties in Jira collector with the below data for the people to not get confused:

> feature.jiraEpicId=

@yong86 Can you make a PR to do this? The documentation has already been updated to reflect this change. Sbrenthughes
484405231 @Sbrenthughes sure, I will make it. yong86

column5: Collector working fine Metrics showing fine in UI but shows pending data collection but it collects data correctly how to remove the yellow dot
column10:
482562560 It is is a Bitcucket collector
 mitunmbj
482592258 From your browser <your_url>/api/dashboard/<dashboard_id>, find the key `application` > `components ` > `collectorItems` > `SCM`. What is the value of the `lastUpdated` key? Sbrenthughes
483021183 @Sbrenthughes 
"name":"zdfzcbx","collectorItems":{"SCM":[{"id":"5cb31732625743335980692c","enabled":true,"errors":[],"pushed":false,"collectorId":"5cb30a406257433451b72a42","lastUpdated":0,"options":

my last updated shows 0.. how to edit this and how to remove pending data collection in UI
 mohanelango
483259268 LastUpdated Being 0 is why the pending update is happening. There maybe an issue with the collector not updating it.
 Sbrenthughes
485860332 Few suggestions:

1. The error threshold in collector property file is too low. Network is never perfect IMHO. I set it to 100. https://github.com/Hygieia/Hygieia/blob/master/collectors/scm/github/docker/properties-builder.sh#L26

2. I added more info about the error by changing `repo.getRepoUrl()` to `ex.getMessage()+" : "+repo.getRepoUrl()` in the exception handlers in https://github.com/Hygieia/Hygieia/blob/master/collectors/scm/github/src/main/java/com/capitalone/dashboard/collector/GitHubCollectorTask.java#L237-L246 . This way, it shows up clearly in the tooltip of the red dot right in the UI.

3. To remove/reset the yellow/red dot, I ran this instruction in MongoDB (Figure your correct object identifier): `db.collector_items.update({"_id":ObjectId("5af2fa6936d1a0000117a972")},{"$set": {"errors": []}});`
 user20170

column2: I have a Jenkins Job which will trigger for every commit in GitHub. I am using Hygieia Jenkins Plugin to publish all data. I can able to get all data in team dashboard but I am not getting any commit data in build stage and no data is displayed in environments stages of product dashboard. If I run Jenkins Collector I am getting commits in build stage but not showing the metrics. [ ](url) Can anyone help me out.
column5: Hygieia Jenkins Plugin is not holding the commits in build stage and Environment Stages
column10:
485852391 Can someone explain what data the environment columns use to correlate with commit and build column's data?

I believe here is the scenario many people would tend to use 
* Commit data **pulled** successfully from Github **collector**. 
* 1. Build data **pulled** successfully from Jenkins **collector**.  - OR -   
* 2. Build data **pushed** successfully from Jenkins through Hygieia **plugin** installed in Jenkins.
* Deployment data **pushed** successfully from Jenkins through Hygieia **plugin** installed in Jenkins via the hygieiaDeployPublishStep function.

Outcome: The commit and Build columns in product dashboard display fine. However the environment columns show empty. What is needed to build the correlation between deployment data and commit/build data? I believe that goes missing in the above scenario for some reason, and hence the environment columns show empty. Or maybe my understanding is incorrect, and I should rather simply ask *how to make it work?*

Any pointers to the code would be appreciated, and will help us hone in better.

I believe this issue is similar to https://github.com/Hygieia/Hygieia/issues/2836 user20170
488051304 Can you paste the `hygieiaDeployPublishStep` you are using? And the Artifact publish step? The `hygieiaDeployPublishStep` used in the deploy job should have the same name and artifact version as the `hygieiaArtifactPublishStep`  of the build job. Sbrenthughes
494669006 
Here i am pasting my product dashboard view as well as jenkins artifact and publisher step.

![Screenshot (28)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48546034/58151598-c0e25b80-7c87-11e9-98e8-ee5330e6e728.png)
![Screenshot (29)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48546034/58151600-c0e25b80-7c87-11e9-9870-05d7ea36a2aa.png)
 IATVirtusa
495369025 Are you using the auto publish functionality? If so these steps will only work when using a Jenkinsfile. Sbrenthughes
498498587 @IATVirtusa Can you confirm if you have implemented the above recommendations ? rvema
500364290 @Sbrenthughes  @rvema now its working fine using Jenkinsfile. gopiprasanthpotipireddy

column2:
I downloaded the latest version of the Hygieia and trying to package it with the following command
```
$ mvn clean install package

```
I got following error message

```
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-compiler-plugin:3.5.1:compile (default-compile) on project api: Compilation failure
[ERROR] /Users/johnd/Downloads/Hygieia/api/src/main/java/com/capitalone/dashboard/service/CommitServiceImpl.java:[23,35] package org.omg.PortableInterceptor does not exist
[ERROR] 
[ERROR] -> [Help 1]
[ERROR] 
[ERROR] To see the full stack trace of the errors, re-run Maven with the -e switch.
[ERROR] Re-run Maven using the -X switch to enable full debug logging.
[ERROR] 
[ERROR] For more information about the errors and possible solutions, please read the following articles:
[ERROR] [Help 1] http://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/MAVEN/MojoFailureException
[ERROR] 
[ERROR] After correcting the problems, you can resume the build with the command
[ERROR]   mvn <goals> -rf :api
```
column5: Hygieia maven package error "package org.omg.PortableInterceptor does not exist"
column10:
485498084 Did you install Hygieia-core first without any issues? Sbrenthughes
485511553 > Did you install Hygieia-core first without any issues?

Yes pavankjadda
485576997 Have you tried without “package” at the end? Sbrenthughes
485858368 Quick question. Hygieia core downloaded into Hygieia-core directory and packaged using `$ mvn clean install package` and Hygieia downloaded into Hygieia. Do we need to combine both? How does packaging Hygieia-core help Hygieia? What's the directory for both? pavankjadda
485858596 > Have you tried without “package” at the end?

Yes. Same error pavankjadda
485888540 That class file comes from the `rt.jar` that ships with java. What compiler are you using?
 chtompki
486011940 maven pavankjadda
486014938 can you run `java -version` and let us know what you see? Also do you have a environment variable named `JAVA_HOME` setup? if so please provide information regarding the same. rvema
486279036 > can you run `java -version` and let us know what you see? Also do you have a environment variable named `JAVA_HOME` setup? if so please provide information regarding the same.

Thanks for asking me that. I have `Java 11` and `Java 8` installed on macOS and I used `jenv` to change the default version to Java 8. For some reason, my terminal took Java 11 as the default version. Changing default Java version to Java 8 solved my issue. I am not sure if Hygieia is compatible with Java 11. Thanks anyway. pavankjadda
494593642 @pavankjadda what was your resolution for this? I am having very similar issues. heffrey
494598110 I was using Java 11, Hygieia supports only Java 8 pavankjadda
494602315 Great, thanks. To further add for any other lost souls: when running `/usr/libexec/java_home -V` I had several versions installed. 

I had to manually set JAVA_HOME to the path leading to Java 8. Simply relying on `$(/usr/libexec/java_home)` to decide the version was futile. In my case this was  `/Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk1.8.0_211.jdk/Contents/Home` heffrey
499059416 Downloading and pointing to JDK 8 version solved my issue.
Thanks @pavankjadda !!!

Run mvn clean install package command again on Hygieia core and then on Hygieia. jsam2412
499059827 Thanks for sharing the solution  rvema

#############################################################################

485840635 For each of these `feature.jiraIssueTypeNames=Story,Bug,Task,Sub-Task,Epic` you need to go to `https://[your-jira-domain-name]/rest/api/2/issuetype` in your browser and get each of their ids. Next you need to add them to the properties file:
```
feature.jiraStoryIds[0]=[Story-id]
feature.jiraStoryIds[1]=[Bug-id]
feature.jiraStoryIds[2]=[Task-id]
feature.jiraStoryIds[3]=[Sub-Task-id]

feature.jiraEpicId=[Epic-id]
```
I am not sure where you found to do `feature.jiraStoryIds[0]=customfield_10001`
`feature.jiraEpicId=customfield_10000`.  Can you show me where you found this so that I can correct it? Sbrenthughes

column2: When an error is thrown for a GraphQL query, the errors are returned in the JSON response.  The errors are checked for "NOT_FOUND", which means that the repo could have been redirected.  A REST call is made to the original repo to look for the new repo url.
column5: Graphql collector fix for redirected repos

column2:
Will look for repo renames, and repo transfers to another org.  Works if there are multiple redirects, all of the redirected repos will point to the last repo.

If the error in the graphQL query is "NOT_FOUND", then it will make a REST call to the original repo to find out if it was redirected.
column5: Update collector to look for redirected repos

#application.properties for JIRA colllector
dbname=dashboarddb
dbhost=localhost
dbport=27017
dbreplicaset=false
dbhostport=[host1:port1,host2:port2,host3:port3]

dbpassword=dbpassword
logging.file=./logs/jira.log
feature.pageSize=100

# Delta change date that modulates the collector item task
# Occasionally, these values should be modified if database size is a concern
feature.deltaStartDate=2016-03-01T00:00:00.000000
feature.masterStartDate=2016-03-01T00:00:00.000000
feature.deltaCollectorItemStartDate=2016-03-01T00:00:00.000000

# Chron schedule: S M D M Y [Day of the Week]
feature.cron=0 * * * * *

# ST Query File Details - Required, but DO NOT MODIFY
feature.queryFolder=jiraapi-queries
feature.storyQuery=story
feature.epicQuery=epic

# JIRA CONNECTION DETAILS:
# Enterprise Proxy - ONLY INCLUDE IF YOU HAVE A PROXY
#feature.jiraProxyUrl=http://proxy.com
#feature.jiraProxyPort=9000
feature.jiraBaseUrl=http://pxxxxdevkb.atlassian.net/
feature.jiraQueryEndpoint=rest/api/2/
# For basic authentication, requires username:password as string in base64
# This command will make this for you:  echo -n username:password | base64

# OAuth is not fully implemented; please blank-out the OAuth values:

#feature.jiraOauthAuthtoken=
#feature.jiraOauthRefreshtoken=
#feature.jiraOauthRedirecturi=
#feature.jiraOauthExpiretime=

#############################################################################
# In Jira, general IssueType IDs are associated to various 'issue'
# attributes. However, there is one attribute which this collector's
# queries rely on that change between different instantiations of Jira.
# Please provide a string name reference to your instance's IssueType for
# the lowest level of Issues (for example, 'user story') specific to your Jira
# instance.  Note:  You can retrieve your instance's IssueType Name
# listings via the following URI:  https://[your-jira-domain-name]/rest/api/2/issuetype/
# Multiple comma-separated values can be specified.
#############################################################################
feature.jiraIssueTypeNames=Story, Epic

#############################################################################
# In Jira, your instance will have its own custom field created for 'sprint' or 'timebox' details,
# which includes a list of information.  This field allows you to specify that data field for your
# instance of Jira. Note: You can retrieve your instance's sprint data field name
# via the following URI, and look for a package name com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.sprint.Sprint;
# your custom field name describes the values in this field:
# https://[your-jira-domain-name]/rest/api/2/issue/[some-issue-name]
#############################################################################
feature.jiraSprintDataFieldName=customfield_10016

#############################################################################
# In Jira, your instance will have its own custom field created for 'super story' or 'epic' back-end ID,
# which includes a list of information.  This field allows you to specify that data field for your instance
# of Jira.  Note:  You can retrieve your instance's epic ID field name via the following URI where your
# queried user story issue has a super issue (for example, epic) tied to it; your custom field name describes the
# epic value you expect to see, and is the only field that does this for a given issue:
# https://[your-jira-domain-name]/rest/api/2/issue/[some-issue-name]
#############################################################################
feature.jiraEpicIdFieldName=customfield_10017

#############################################################################
# In Jira, your instance will have its own custom field created for 'story points'
# This field allows you to specify that data field for your instance
# of Jira.  Note:  You can retrieve your instance's storypoints ID field name via the following URI where your
# queried user story issue has story points set on it; your custom field name describes the
# story points value you expect to see:
# https://[your-jira-domain-name]/rest/api/2/issue/[some-issue-name]
#############################################################################
feature.jiraStoryPointsFieldName=customfield_10021

#############################################################################
# In Jira, your instance will have its own custom field created for 'team'
# This field allows you to specify that data field for your instance
# of Jira.  Note:  You can retrieve your instance's team ID field name via the following URI where your
# queried user story issue has team set on it; your custom field name describes the
# team value you expect to see:
# https://[your-jira-domain-name]/rest/api/2/issue/[some-issue-name]
#############################################################################
#feature.jiraTeamFieldName=

#############################################################################
# In Jira, your instance will have its own Id for the issueTypes. 
# You can retrieve the issueType IDs from the following API request:
# https://[your-jira-domain-name]/rest/api/2/issuetype
#############################################################################
feature.jiraStoryIds[0]=60711
#feature.jiraStoryIds[1]=

#############################################################################
# In Jira, your instance will have its own Id for the Epic
# You can find the value from the following API request:
# https://[your-jira-domain-name]/rest/api/2/issuetype
#############################################################################
#feature.jiraEpicId=54614

# Defines how to update features per board. If true then only update based on enabled collectorItems otherwise full update
#feature.collectorItemOnlyUpdate=

#Defines the maximum number of features allow per board. If limit is reach collection will not happen for given board
#feature.maxNumberOfFeaturesPerBoard=

# Set this to true if you use boards as team
feature.jiraBoardAsTeam=true

I have tried all the solution provided by @Sbrenthughes but still unable to get the rallyserver value inserted in database.

Is there anything which I should be doing. 

Step taken so far - 

1. Deleted the beans file and recreated the jar
2. Deleted the document from database and re run the collector
3. Deleted the database as well and re executed all the steps

here is my config file - 

# Database Name
dbname=dashboarddb

# Database HostName - default is localhost
dbhost=127.0.0.1

# Database Port - default is 27017
dbport=27017

# Database Username - default is blank
dbusername=

# Database Password - default is blank
dbpassword=

# Collector schedule (required)
rally.cron=0 0/5 * * * *

# Rally server(s) (required) - Can provide multiple
rally.servers[0]=https://rally1.rallydev.com

# Rally username/password for the provided server- with read-access to all resources.
rally.usernames[0]=<username>
rally.passwords[0]=<password>

#logging.level.com.capitalone.dashboard.collector=DEBUG



Actually, I see where the collector didn't insert the server URL. Can you try deleting that row and rerunning the collector?

column5: Sonar collector can't fetch private projects
column10: 479120805 And also there is no data showing for the following three parts: yanranzhao 482672373 Can you verify that the credentials you are using have access? And the Sonar collector doesn't fill out the other 3 Sbrenthughes 482675477 @Sbrenthughes thanks for your reply. I'm pretty sure that my credentials have access. And how to fetch other 3 data? yanranzhao 500002663 @yanranzhao. did you figure out how to fetch the data? I'm having trouble getting that to work. JFDonaghy 500911656 Got it! For those of you working on it, the server is where sonar is listening (so http://localhost:9000, so the like) and, once you have the UI running, you fetch with java -jar sonar-codequality-collector-3.0.2-SNAPSHOT.jar --spring.config.name=sonar --spring.config.location=[path to application.properties file] and, importantly, wait. The collector needs time to fetch the data. Once I had things in my dropdown, nothing showed up at first, but, as I searched online, enough time passed for the magic to work. JFDonaghy

# Database Name
dbname=dashboarddb

# Database HostName - default is localhost
dbhost=localhost

# Database Port - default is 27017
dbport=27017

# MongoDB replicaset
dbreplicaset=false
dbhostport=[localhost:27017,127.0.0.1:27017,127.0.0.:27017]

# Database Username - default is blank
dbusername=dashboarduser

# Database Password - default is blank

feature.deltaStartDate=2016-03-01T00:00:00.000000
feature.masterStartDate=2016-03-01T00:00:00.000000
feature.deltaCollectorItemStartDate=2016-03-01T00:00:00.000000

# Chron schedule: S M D M Y [Day of the Week]

# In Jira, general IssueType IDs are associated to various 'issue'

#############################################################################

#############################################################################

#############################################################################

#############################################################################

#############################################################################
feature.jiraStoryPointsFieldName=customfield_10023

#############################################################################
# In Jira, your instance will have its own custom field created for 'team'
# This field allows you to specify that data field for your instance

#############################################################################
feature.jiraTeamFieldName=

# Set this to true if you use boards as team
feature.jiraBoardAsTeam=true IATVirtusa

478969586 1) Go here `https://<URL>/rest/api/2/issuetype` and get the ids of the issuetypes that you want to pull.
2) For each issuetype, except epic, you need to add the following:
`feature. jiraStoryIds[0]=<id_from_above>`
`feature. jiraStoryIds[1]=<next_id_from_above>`
Mare sure `feature.jiraIssueTypeNames=` is filled out. It is a comma separated string of the issuetype names you want to pull
3) Get the epic id from step 1 and add it here: 
`feature.jiraEpicId=`
4) Make sure each of the following are field out correctly:
```
feature.jiraSprintDataFieldName=
feature.jiraEpicIdFieldName=
feature.jiraStoryPointsFieldName=
feature.jiraTeamFieldName=
```
5) Once the above has be verified to be correct, delete the Team, Scope and Feature collections. Finally, in the `collectors` collection find the Jira collector and set `lastRefreshTime` and `lastExecuted` to `0`

We will hopefully be simplifying it further in the near future. Sbrenthughes

column5: Issue: Hygieia api-audit and Jenkins (exit code 1)
column10:
486648295 @vishalraina Can you update the docker documentation so that @mySphere can resolve this issue? rvema
487308554 @rvema I am working on the doing builds for Hygieia UI and API containers will update documentation for the same. vishalraina
492916871 To fix the MONGO_PORT not defined, you need to manually set the environmental variable. Example below:
`
jenkins-build-collector:

    build: collectors/build/jenkins
    image: hygieia-jenkins-build-collector
    environment:
      - MONGO_PORT=tcp://10.0.2.2:27017
    depends_on:
      - db-setup
`

However, after you fix this, another problem occurs and you will get the following below. I'm currently stuck at this point.

> Timed out after 30000 ms while waiting for a server that matches PrimaryServerSelector. matthewLee711
492924864 @matthewLee711 are you using docker swarm ? or individual docker containers?  vishalraina
492933201 I'm using docker-compose. So a quick update, I just resolved the issue by setting the mongo port and host to be dynamic with the db container. The following below works for most collectors. I say most, because some of the other containerized collectors have weird issues and I haven't spent enough time looking into them.
 
`
bitbucket-collector:

      build: collectors/scm/bitbucket
      image: hygieia-bitbucket-scm-collector
      environment:
        - MONGO_PORT=tcp://db:27017
        - MONGODB_HOST=db
        - HYGIEIA_API_ENV_SPRING_DATA_MONGODB_DATABASE=dashboarddb
        - HYGIEIA_API_ENV_SPRING_DATA_MONGODB_USERNAME=dashboarduser
        - HYGIEIA_API_ENV_SPRING_DATA_MONGODB_PASSWORD=dbpassword
        - SPRING_DATA_MONGODB_REPSET=false
        - BITBUCKET_HOST=api.bitbucket.org
        - BITBUCKET_API=/2.0/repositories/
        - BITBUCKET_KEY=redacted
      depends_on:
        - db-setup
` matthewLee711
498499235 Closing the issue since this is resolved. rvema

column2:
Hi Team,
i am trying to create a docker image and deploy in cloud as a POC , hence i am looking for a way to test the dashboard locally once i deploy the docker image.
we have this command to test locally --> gulp serve --local true
but for docker we will be executing the command --> docker run -t -p 8088:80 --link hygieia-api -i hygieia-ui:latest

can anyone please let me know how to use test data for UI when API/UI/DB are containerized.

Regards,
vishal
column5: how to test UI locally for docker

497755203 @vishalbisa I am not familiar with loading test data to hygieia. I will try read up but will likely be sometime before I can respond back about it. Sbrenthughes
497799363 Thanks @Sbrenthughes  apologies for adding another issue, i am trying to use jenkins collector with open source jenkins ( https://ci.jenkins.io ), i am getting the error as MONGO_PORT is not defined attached below screenshot, also attached my properties-buildler.sh file.
i am not sure from where these parameters are fetching as i dont see those in my properties file.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16570454/58724123-6a002300-83f9-11e9-8fdd-01dbfdc41d6a.png)

[jenkins.txt](https://github.com/Hygieia/Hygieia/files/3242305/jenkins.txt)

Thanks in advance vishalbisa
504017369 @vishalbisa Were you able to fix this issue?
I updated collectors>build>jenkins>docker>properties-builder.sh as below and MONGO_PORT error was resolved;

_MONGO_PORT=tcp://db:27017
if [ "$MONGO_PORT" != "" ]; then_

As I am also working on similar POC to deploy Hygieia on kubernetes cluster. were you able to bring UI up?

 I am getting error for UI container:
**host not found in upstream "api" in /etc/nginx/conf.d/default.conf:26** ekta-thakur
504121387 @ekta yes I was able to resolve the issue and my POC is completed by setting up one widget SCM using GitHub.

To troubleshoot the issue please let me know so that we can have a screen share session so that I can fix it faster  vishalbisa

 ekta-thakur

column2:
facing some issues while trying to get the udeploy collector integrated with the dashboard.I am able to see the apps being pulled from udeploy in the logs but the same isn't reflecting in the widget on the dashboard.

We already have a working setup for Jenkins where we are able to view the builds on the build widget but we are facing issues while trying to get that working for udeploy and Bitbucket(public repo)


[udeploy_prop.txt](https://github.com/Hygieia/Hygieia/files/3013341/udeploy_prop.txt)
[udeploy-collector.log](https://github.com/Hygieia/Hygieia/files/3013335/udeploy-collector.log)
column5: udeploy collector
column10:
477225319 @Sbrenthughes Can you please take a look.  HarshitMit
477228136 Is this a local deployment? 
If this is local can you comment out `dbreplicaset=false`
and `dbhostport=localhost:27017,127.0.0.1:27017` 
 Sbrenthughes
477277064 @Sbrenthughes no, this is not a local deployment. I'm trying to connect it to the udeploy dev instance of my organization.

I tried commenting out the above mentioned properties but still the same issue 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48964639/55099894-95f3e500-50e6-11e9-9af7-e29b8d34f863.png)

 HarshitMit
477287160 @Sbrenthughes 
Now  I can see some of the udeploy applications being listed  in mongodb when I give db.collector_items.find() but still these applications aren't reflecting in the dashboard.
 HarshitMit
477517672 I am facing the same problem. which udeploy version are you trying to get data from? I have seen that the requests that are made to udeploy return no results, maybe the API changed from 6.x to 7.x? cahi
477577051 @cahi  Well, I'm able to fetch the data from udeploy to the mongodb instance but am unable to get that data in the udeploy widget on the dashboard.

we are using 6.2.1 version of udeploy.  HarshitMit
477583948 @HarshitMit check out https://github.com/Hygieia/Hygieia/issues/2773. Changing the port it is running on could cause it to place it in the right mongo db. Sbrenthughes
477595507 @Sbrenthughes  I am not sure if the data from udeploy is being pushed in the right table in mongodb but I do see the data from udeploy being present in mongodb when I run **db.collector_items.find()**

{ "_id" : ObjectId("dk12371e"), "_class" : "com.capitalone.dashboard.model.UDeployApplication", "description" : "XXXXX", "enabled" : false, "errors" : [ ], "pushed" : false, "collectorId" : ObjectId("5c52ff606a866d1dfaa8d4b6"), "lastUpdated" : NumberLong(0), "options" : { "applicationId" : "837fae26-314d-4c97-9cea-e6f7376ebfd7", "applicationName" : "xmmdnyz", "instanceUrl" : "https://udeploy.XXXXXXX" } }
{ "_id" : ObjectId("255f571f"), "_class" : "com.capitalone.dashboard.model.UDeployApplication", "description" : "xxxxx", "enabled" : false, "errors" : [ ], "pushed" : false, "collectorId" : ObjectId("5c52ff606a866d1dfaa8d4b6"), "lastUpdated" : NumberLong(0), "options" : { "applicationId" : "192093e5-5466-4457-8d70-25a82cc3361e", "applicationName" : "lmnkjsabf", "instanceUrl" : "https://udeploy.XXXXXXX" } }
{ "_id" : ObjectId("255f5720"), "_class" : "com.capitalone.dashboard.model.UDeployApplication", "description" : "XXX", "enabled" : false, "errors" : [ ], "pushed" : false, "collectorId" : ObjectId("5c52ff606a866d1dfaa8d4b6"), "lastUpdated" : NumberLong(0), "options" : { "applicationId" : "b19569f7-c0d9-453c-8e38-7810c9a27207", "applicationName" : "", "instanceUrl" : "https://udeploy.XXXXXXX" } }

But, I'll still take a look at #2773 and check with @ansha1 to get more insight on the issue.





 HarshitMit
478064922 Finally it's working now. Checked out the latest api code changes and that kinda seems to have fixed the issue.  HarshitMit

column5: udeploy not writing to mongodb

477146488 @HarshitMit typically we ask that you paste your properties file, any errors that are in the logs and any steps you've tried to resolve this. Simply creating a blank issue doesn't help us to help you. Sbrenthughes
477159577  Please find more details in issue #2801 HarshitMit

column2:
I have made changes to feature model in hygieia core to add priority and severity fields. Build of Hygieia core is successful. SNAPSHOT of core jar got created.

While compiling feature-collector new attributes of feature model is not resolved and compilation error is thrown.
column5: hygieia core model change is not considered in feature collector build
column10:
474309221 modifying jira-feature collector pom file to explicitly defining com.capitalone.dashboard version as 3.1.0-SNAPSHOT resolved the compilation issue. 
 rishi-mukherjee

column2:
Hi
I am trying to publish Jacoco Coverage trend published via Jenkins build on my Hygieia: Code Quality widget.
In Jenkins my Jacoco Code Coverage shows data:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24870997/54532175-27f44300-49ad-11e9-9bbc-1c1bdd8b3522.png)

But is inconsistant with Hygieia: Jenkins-codequality module.

The JSON object I get from Jenkins for code quality is like: 
{"branchCoverage":{"covered":0,"missed":44815,"percentage":0,"percentageFloat":0.0,"total":44815},"classCoverage":{"covered":3,"missed":109,"percentage":3,"percentageFloat":2.6785715,"total":112},"complexityScore":{"covered":13,"missed":24606,"percentage":0,"percentageFloat":0.052804746,"total":24619},"instructionCoverage":{"covered":61,"missed":378392,"percentage":0,"percentageFloat":0.01611825,"total":378453},"lineCoverage":{"covered":27,"missed":68241,"percentage":0,"percentageFloat":0.03955001,"total":68268},"methodCoverage":{"covered":13,"missed":2197,"percentage":1,"percentageFloat":0.5882353,"total":2210}}

Please suggest is it possible to integrate Jenkins jacoco code coverage report with existing Hygieia Code Quality widget 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24870997/54532511-ec0dad80-49ad-11e9-9dac-6b83aaff3226.png)

or I have to create a new collector altogether to display this data.

 Thanks in advance
column5: Hygieia: Configuring Code Analysis widget with Jacoco Coverage report
column10:
476073101 Any help appreciated  yash4necro
477232822 Would you be able to paste a copy of .xml generated?  Sbrenthughes
477885731 PFA the attached test results xml.
[report.txt](https://github.com/Hygieia/Hygieia/files/3021392/report.txt)
 yash4necro
483342281 @yash4necro Thanks, I am hoping to get to this soon.  Sbrenthughes
484669889 ~If you output your jacoco report in *xml* it'll load with the "CodeQuality" stuff, either jenkins collector or job based.

I don't have support for son output from jacoco atm~

Oh... I see you mean its not showing up in the UI! Worth checking the api logs? stevegal
